CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States May 1, 2019
CommentsContent: I use to use a microwave or a medium pot to boil water for a cup of noodles or to have a glass of tea, but what a difference this kettle makes. I plugged it in , followed the instructions and within minutes I had hot water. The large kettle size provides approximately 8 cups of water. The glass build allows you to see though the kettle and watch the water bubbles come to a boil. The location of the predefined buttons is a great feature and the 6 predefined settings to be set very quickly. Safety feature to auto shutoff and the led blinking light remind me that the kettle is still on while in warm mode. I have never used a kettle before but i was impressed with this one. No more pots or microwave in my immediate future.

CommentsTitle: Much Better Than a Stove Top Kettle
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States May 10, 2019
CommentsContent: This is a really nice unit if you boil water often.  My wife likes to take a thermos full of hot water with her to work so each morning she puts a kettle on the stove and goes about other morning chores.  When the kettle whistles, you drop everything and run to take the kettle off the burner.  The HadinEEon Electric Kettle makes this morning routine much simpler and far less worrisome.  At full capacity it will bring 8 cups of water to a full boil in about 8 minutes.  It‚Äôs also a clear glass kettle so you can see your water come to a boil.  There are multiple temperature selections and a "Keep Warm" feature so all you have to do is set and go.  A blue light ring let‚Äôs you know the unit is on.  It shuts off when your water is boiling and intermittently turns back on and off to keep your water at the desired temp until you‚Äôre ready to go.  No more scrambling to shut off a screaming stove top kettle and water is piping hot when you pour!  Love it, this gadget get my thumbs up!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States May 2, 2019
CommentsContent: This is my second time purchasing this kettle. I really recommend it!

CommentsTitle: Nice addition to my collection of teas

One thing that I still need to get used to - it doesn't beep when you press on different temperature buttons. Basically, one it starts glowing, it's heating up the water. Besides that, it's pretty easy to use.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 24, 2019
CommentsContent: This seems like a very nice electric kettle.  I like that it has different temperatures for the different types of tea and the pot seems to hold more water than my last kettle did.  That being said, with the pot I received a notice from the manufacturer stating that if I reviewed the kettle and sent them a copy of it, I could choose from one of six items that they would send me for free.  The implication is to give them a good review.  I did not send them a copy of this review; it's my honest opinion and the company doesn't need  stoop to this type of practice.  The pot can stand on its merits.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 16, 2019
CommentsContent: This has stopped working within 4 months!  Don‚Äôt buy ..  it is not reliable!!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 28, 2020
CommentsContent: I honestly don't understand how this listing has so many positive reviews and no one mentioning a bad smell.I received one Kettle, ran two batches of water, then a 1/3 white vinegar 2/3 water boiled through, left overnight, and rinsed with two batches of water. Same. Exact. Problem.If you are looking for a kettle that doesn't leech some weird chemical into your water or produces water that smells like something you'd actually like to consume, look elsewhere.

CommentsContent: I absolutely love this kettle! I love that it not only has the temperature control, but also tells you what tea would go at that temperature. It‚Äôs very sleek looking as well with the clear glass, blue LED, and well made handle. Great investment if you like tea, coffee, hot water with lemon, and the list goes on and on!

CommentsContent: Kettle won't turn on, so frustrating.  I am returning the product, waste of my time, should have listened to the other buyers with the same experience before purchasing.  Definitely a design defect! Faulty!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 19, 2019

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States May 5, 2019
CommentsContent: We got this kettle a couple of days ago and like the looks of it a lot.  We also like the various temperatures for different teas and coffee and find they do make a difference. CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 5, 2019
CommentsContent: The modern glass kettle looks very bright with six different temperature settings for various tea. My wife loves it as it is easy to use and clean. Besides, you can see though the blue glass kettle and watch the water bubbles come to a boil.It is really cool and makes me have a lot of fun. Furthermore, it makes hot water very fast and I do not have to make hot water again and again with the keep-warm function.I am very happy with this new product which has upgraded my life style. I highly recommmend this product to my friends as I am showing it off.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 29, 2020
CommentsContent: Just want to add now that I have had the replacement kettle for almost a month... it is working perfectly. Better than the first one actually. It happens we sometimes get a defective model of something but the company went above and beyond to make it right. I highly recommend the HadinEEon Kettle.Last and FINAL Update. i think.Surprisingly the company saw my Review and reached out to me. I never expected that after so much time had elapsed.They apologized for the problems with both the kettle and that I had not received a response. Wary at first at receiving an email out of the blue I called Amazon Customer Service to find out how I could verify it was indeed from the company.  After getting a contact number from Amazon I called and confirmed the email was legitimate.  Once I did that I returned the email from Stephen of Customer Service and have received a replacement for the kettle.I'm thrilled they did honor the Warranty. I loved the Kettle and was so disappointed it had problems. I have made pour over coffee forever now and tea all the time. I am so happy to have the kettle replaced.Having had this very positive interaction I raised the Rating from 1 Star to 5.~It seems this company's "Warranty" is pretend. I do not think they will ever reply.~I have been trying to get the Company to honor their Warranty and replace the Kettle. So far. NO luck. I will Update if they honor their Warranty.~I do not Review often. When I do it either exceeds expectations or fails miserably. Nor do I ever Review immediately for an offer of a 5 Star review. Ever. When I do it is because I have used an item for some time and it either meet the criteria.In this case this Kettle has turned out to be a Hazard. I purchased the Kettle in March to replace an old fashioned stove top teapot my teen accidentally boiled to dry. Up until this week I was very pleased. It did what it was promised to do.However. This week it stopped turning off after the temperature was met. I came out from the computer room to find the pot was boiling away at the highest setting and had boiled away half the pot instead of shutting off. Initially I thought I had made a mistake. For a couple of days it was normal. But today it is not only back every time I try to make water for tea at the appropriate temp. I just boils away at high no matter the setting.Ironically. I was initially happy enough I was planning to purchase a back up in the event the glass pot ever broke. I make Pour Over coffee and tea so to be without a pot even for a day is not an option. Especially in these times.To pay slightly over $50.00 when I purchased and only get 8 months of use and to be a fire hazard is completely not acceptable.

CommentsTitle: Did not work straight out of the box.  Read other reviews about this product not working.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States May 27, 2019
CommentsContent: Product was taken out of the box and set up per the instruction manual.  After plugging in the base, placing carafe with water in it, the unit beeps once with a flash of blue light and then nothing.  Double checked the instruction manual, pushed the temp button and start button within 1 second of the beep and blue light... and nothing.  Tried 3 different outlets, nothing.  Just a beep and a flash of blue light.  Faulty product.  Big disappointment.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 7, 2020
CommentsContent: Update: I've been using this kettle for about a week and it's starting to falter. It used to beep when the temperature level was reached. Now it turns itself on and off. I can only imagine what it will be like in another week. I'm returning it.Also, you should probably take these glowing reviews with a grain of salt. When you receive your kettle they offer you a 'free' gift if you contact them. Once you do, they ask you to review their product. I normally never review a new product but decided to. I initially gave them a 4 star review based on my thoughts underneath and that wasn't good enough. They contacted me and asked me to change my star rating to 5 and offered me a $10 gift card and reminded me how generous they were being giving me a 'free' gift. So they are essentially buying reviews. I told them to keep their gift, I wasn't changing my review. Now of course I am because the product is starting to glitch.I bought this kettle to replace an older one I had. I chose this because I wanted a kettle that allows me to choose the temperature of the water I am boiling. It's very handy for someone who drinks french press coffee and various teas because they all have their own temperature recommendations. I like that this kettle had more temperature settings vs my older one. The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars is because I haven't had it long enough to see how well it  holds up and because of a safety concern I have. You have to unplug the kettle after each use. If you leave the kettle on the base with it turned off, the kettle will periodically turn itself on and off. It wasn't clear in the instructions that you need to unplug it and someone may leave not knowing it can turn itself on.

CommentsTitle: Ok kettle for the price, not the best quality
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 11, 2020
CommentsContent: This kettle is ok for the price, it looks nice and heats the water efficiently, but after owning it for about a week I noticed it stopped beeping to let me know when the water had reached the correct temperature. It still beeps for boiling water, but not for any of the other temperature settings. Other than that, it works as intended.Edited to add: The company has continued to reach out to me asking me to remove my "negative" review so I'm removing stars for sketchy sales behavior. I still have this kettle and still have issues with it not beeping when it reaches temperature. If/when this one stops working I won't be buying this brand again.

CommentsTitle: Great addition to the kitchen for the tea lover, but not perfect
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States May 23, 2020
CommentsContent: We purchased this to replace a 5-yr old name brand kettle that we‚Äôve used daily - and it‚Äôs finally dying. I debated about whether to go with a large ‚Äúname brand‚Äù or to take a gamble on a lesser-known brand. I guess the adventurer in me caused me to try the lesser-known brand. Plus, it doesn‚Äôt ever hurt to save a few dollars if you can get something that‚Äôs good and lasts.When I review, I rarely give 5-stars unless a product is exceptional. This product seems great so far, but not exceptional.Here are the great things:* The various water temperatures that are easy to access on the handle* Gets the job done of heating the water quickly, and holding it at temp if you want it to* Cool blue lights that make the water sparkle* Handle is easy to grip* It was well packaged and easy to get set up* Though made of glass, it seems quite sturdy* Claims to be BPA Free* Elegant look for the kitchen* Easy to useMinuses:* The lid is not as easy to open as our old kettle, which allowed opening it with a flick of the thumb on the open button. This one is a two handed job of holding the kettle with one hand while manipulating the lid lever with the other* The ‚Äúkeep warm‚Äù feature is not 100% intuitive, and worse, it deactivates as soon as you take the kettle off the base to pour water. So if you want it to keep on keeping on (warm), then you have to remember to re-activate it once there. Our previous kettle had its functions built into the base, and it remembered to keep it warm if the feature was turned on. That was more convenient.Decent but not great:* For those of us who live at higher altitudes - where water boils at 205F instead of 212F - I have not yet found a kettle that can efficiently deal with that. This one does okay but could be better: If you set the water for a full boil, it will boil for several minutes until it figures out that it‚Äôs not going all the way to 212F. It will then ‚Äúbeep‚Äù and temporarily pause boiling, try to boil it again for a shorter time, then finally switch into the keep warm mode where it alternatively boils the water and pauses. It seems somewhat random how long the periods of boiling are - some are very short, some last longer. This is better than our previous kettle which didn‚Äôt deal with the issue at all - but it is still wasting a lot of energy spending all that time keeping the water at a high boil before figuring it out. As a former computer programmer, it doesn‚Äôt seem like it would be hard to build in control circuitry to deal with this issue more intelligently.So, would I recommend it? For the price, yes. It‚Äôs a nice kettle at a good price - especially for one that has all the different temperatures needed for producing the best brewing results of different kinds of tea. However, if some of the small issues aren‚Äôt addressed, when this one wears out, I‚Äôll probably keep looking for the ‚Äúperfect‚Äù kettle (which I admittedly may never find).

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 18, 2019
CommentsContent: I‚Äôve bought A kettle from this brand before, since it‚Äôs sooo easy to use so I bought one more with several temperature control functions! The packing was sooo thoughtful and organized. The transparent look makes the kettle so different and elegant, I enjoyed very much watching the water spoiling. This kettle has so many temperature controls for different kinds of needs, I think that‚Äôs enough for daily use. CommentsTitle: Good sturdy kettle, big reservoir, easy to use.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 4, 2019
CommentsContent: I received the kettle promptly. I like how the chord wraps in the base so I don‚Äôt have a length of chord sitting on my counter. The kettle has six temperatures and a keep warm fixture. It lights up blue when its heating and beeps when it‚Äôs done so you know it‚Äôs ready which I appreciate. It also has quite a large reservoir which I also appreciate. It also heats up quickly. The only issue I have is the design of the temp butons. CommentsTitle: It doesn't heat up at all. Defective.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 4, 2020
CommentsContent: When I looked at the box, I already noticed it might have been a return, but I figured I'll try it any ways. The control panel is defective, and it doesn't even heat up to 200F. CommentsTitle: Just as good as its predecessor for boiling water, much better for tea lovers.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 14, 2019
CommentsContent: I had its predecessor and have had it for about a year now and there's nothing to complaint about it. This one is the exact same but with the added feature of temperature alternatives for different tea leafs.It is one of the fastest electric kettle available as far as I know, and the fastest I have had. I have heard many times that 1 minute longer will not change your life, but for someone as impacient as me, 1 minute is a LOT of time when cooking. This electric kettle takes about 7 minutes to boil, compared to the 10+minutes that my previous electric kettle took to boil (not the hadinEEon, but a generic brand electric kettle).I fully recommend this version if you like tea, otherwise, the simpler version is just as good (and maybe cheaper).

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 1, 2019
CommentsContent: I have had a few days to test this kettle out, and this is my early assessment of it.Aesthetically, it is quite nice, matches the other small appliances I have and footprint on the counter is not terrible. I was replacing a 1.5L T-fal pot because I wanted more precise control over the temperature of my water. I have made several cups of tea and heated water for use on the stove, and the experience is pretty much as expected. Where are a couple minor cons, this is still a kettle I would recommend. They aren't deal breakers for me, but for some people they might be, so here they are:1.) Temperature: This was the primary reason that I got the kettle, and also the only reason this is a 4-star review instead of a 5-star one. The T-fal I had had a dial that would be ~167 F at the bottom and boil at any other point along the selector. As I like a variety of different kinds of tea that are best steeped at several different temperatures, this was inconvenient. This kettle is off by 5-7 degrees (under, not over) at its various settings (I have tested them all, with two different thermometers, one digital, one analog) except for boiling. As I am not interested in spending over $100 on a kettle with a super precise sensor, and this is still a dramatic improvement over what I had, I can absolutely live with it, as long as this one continues to function at its current level of accuracy.2.) No chime: Only a couple reviews mention one, and nowhere in the product description does it say there is one, so I think this is meant to be a feature of its quiet operation. It's a minor inconvenience for me since I don't wait right next to the kettle when it's heating up the water. I am an insomniac though, so I see it being a boon for when I am up in the middle of the night and want some chamomile or valerian tea.3.) I realize that coming from a plastic kettle to a glass kettle, and one with a larger capacity at that, this kettle will be heavier than what I am used to. I still was not prepared for how heavy it is when it's full. Since I often use my electric kettle to give water for pasta a head-start, carrying a glass kettle full of boiling hot water across the kitchen when only the handle is cool to the touch is a little harrowing. I have an outlet closer to the hob though, so I can simply move it when I plan to do that.Overall I am very happy with it, and will update if for some reason I ever need to make use of the warranty.

CommentsTitle: If you love coffee/tea/yourself, get this electric kettle.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 17, 2019
CommentsContent: I drink coffee and tea almost every day. The HadinEEon kettle let‚Äôs you choose the right temperature for whatever drink you‚Äôre trying to prepare. It‚Äôs stylish and very easy to use. I‚Äôve had over 4 water boilers in the past 5 years and this is easily my favorite one!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States April 30, 2019
CommentsContent: The HadinEEon electric Kettle is a GAME CHANGER for me!  I work long hours and tend to forget to hydrate.  I would spend a lot of money buying tea, but never made it for myself because of the hassle of going to the kitchen, filling up the traditional stove top kettle and waiting for it to heat etc.  Now that I have the HadinEEon Kettle, it sits next to me and I fill up on tea all day long.  The fact that the instructions have a chart that tell me what temperature suits which teas best is super cool and I am starting to feel like less a brash american and more a sophisticated Brit who knows a thing or two about tea time (not really - but a girl can dream!).

CommentsTitle: I actually use all of the features!
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States April 23, 2020
CommentsContent: What I wanted:I have a 64 oz / 2 liter insulated growler which I use to make tea that I to bring to the office (in non-pandemic times).  My previous electric kettle only held 48oz of water, so I had to run it twice in order to make a full container of tea.This kettle solves this problem by heating up enough water to make my tea in one go.Unexpectedly useful features:I didn't expect to use any of the other features, but I've found the temperature selection to be very useful.  It turns out that green tea tastes better and is easier to drink at 175 degrees F, so I now use that feature every time.  My insulated growler holds the temperature well enough that I can still make tea in the morning and have hot-ish tea in the evening, even if I don't wring every possible degree out of the water.  So, while I wasn't looking for this feature, I now really appreciate it.I also use the "Keep Warm" feature constantly.  I didn't buy this kettle for the "Keep Warm" function, but I'm a fan.Lastly, I love the glass container.  I can see the water level from across the kitchen, I can check for scaling at a glance (scaling used to sneak up on my with the stainless steel electric kettle I had before), and it looks nice.  The glass appears to be the same kind of glass used in coffee makers, and it works even better here than it does in a coffee maker, because the water stays cleaner.Usability notes:I had to read the manual in order to understand how the "Keep Warm" feature works.  It's only active after the kettle has finished the water through the main heating cycle.  (I had assumed that it would slowly heat the water on low power if activated separately.)  Since I find engineering-language comfortable, I would have preferred that the button be labeled "Temperature Hold üîí", since that more accurately describes this function.  Still, it only took about 2 minutes to read the manual, and I use this function frequently, so it's a win.Another usability issue is that I'm about 60%/40% ambidextrous, and 2 of my three kids are left-handed.  The writing on the glass is only in the ideal position when you are holding the handle in my right hand.  When I hold the pitcher in my left hand (which I do almost half the time), it's harder to see the fill-markings (because I'm frequently filling it up to the 2L / Maximum level).  Putting the labels on both sides would be better.Overall, this thing is really easy to use.  These are nitpicks, not showstoppers.Silly novelty features:The bottom of the kettle warms up a light blue when the heating element is activated.  My first thought upon seeing it was that is was a silly imitation of Cherenkov radiation but, upon further reflection, I suppose it's supposed to look like the blue flames from a gas stove.  I still think it looks silly, but it is very useful to have a visual indicator.  The novelty of having a couple of dozen LEDs shine through the water wore off very quickly, while the utility of being able to see when the kettle is heating remains.Conclusion:Overall, this is a huge upgrade from the 48oz stainless steel electric kettle we had before.  Overall, the capacity matches my needs, the improved the temperature control makes my tea better, and I really like being able to see inside the glass container and see its status from across the kitchen.  Overall, I'm very glad I bought this.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 6, 2019
CommentsContent: I'd had a ceramic electric kettle for years, which broke, requiring a replacement. My husband had complained for ALL of those years about the noise level from that kettle.The HadinEEon Variable Temperature Electric Kettle does precisely what it says it will do--the variable temperature controls work beautifully. It's considerably quieter than my last one. And the fact that I can choose to keep it warm for a bit means that if I want a second cup of tea, my husband doesn't have to endure the rumbling noise of boiling water a second time. Win-win. ;) It's not light in the hand when filled with water, but it also does NOT rattle around on its base while boiling, which is good. The design is attractive, and I like the blue LED factor.I will note that the directions say to boil and pour out a first carafe of water to clean it for first use. The plate at the bottom immediately showed some spotting after that first time, so I put a mix of water and vinegar in (per the descaling directions) and boiled again, which cleared up the discolorations on the plate immediately. Word to the wise. :)

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 20, 2019
CommentsContent: We absolutely love this kettle. It is a handsome rig and works very well. The new option of the specific temperature selection buttons are a wonderful update and we use them all the time. Another cool feature is the "KEEP WARM" button. (Nice touch.)They have addressed a flaw from the previous model with the lid not closing properly. The positioning of the new lid release latch is just a little awkward but works smoothly and the lid shuts tight the first time, everytime.Overall a wonderful product and we would recommend it to everyone.

CommentsTitle: Worked well for a month then began falling apart.  Seller is unresponsive.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 19, 2020
CommentsContent: I bought this electric kettle about 2 months ago.  For the first month, it worked great! The stay warm feature was nice.  Now the lid is starting to disintegrate and plastic pieces keep falling into the water.  Amazon recommended I email support@hadineeon.com directly for help.  I've now reached out twice in the past week and nobody has gotten back to me.  I DO NOT recommend - flimsy construction and no support from the seller.

CommentsTitle: its ok, it works, the temperature is not too precise
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 25, 2020
CommentsContent: I owned a few kettles with temperature control. Expensive or not they all failed in one way or another, some had trouble turning off, some could not keep a consistent temperature. Some lasted very short time. Don't panic, so far this item is pretty solid.COVID update: staying at home really increased the use of the teapot 10 fold. Meaning it‚Äôs equivalent to about 10 years of my normal use. I‚Äôm happy to say the teapot is operational. Quite a few times it boiled the water away and it was all fine. The reason I‚Äôm not bumping the extra star is because I discovered another bug, when it stops reheating water. This happens quite rare, but it felt like it happens when you least expect it.  See below.cons:* temperature control is not too precise. To be more specific, ‚Äú200‚Äù is actually 205 and ‚Äú190‚Äù is 185.* keep warm should be called "keep" there is no option to actually keep warm (110- 130 F) water* you can't turn off the beeps.* the water filter is not aligned very well with the contour of the nozzle, so if you have some mineral deposit you might get it in your tea.* sometimes, very rarely, when it keeps certain temperature, and you pick it up and put it back, it silently stops keeping tit warm. While most of the time, as expected, it remembers the temperature for 12 hrs. I wish I can set this time myself.pros:* It works* Quite reliable: daily use while work-from-home restrictions.* Forget the water boiling? it‚Äôs ok, it will boil it away and then stop.

CommentsTitle: A great kettle not to buy
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 26, 2019
CommentsContent: The kettle stopped working within a day of me receiving it, it's blue buttons emitting blue light on and off without it turning on. Also, it's very heavy, and the multitude of metal surfaces make it risky to touch when it does turn on. I had a cheap plastic kettle before it and perhaps I'll go back to it. This is no more than a low cost production, grade Z Chinese kettle which is not worth yours or anyone's money.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States May 24, 2019
CommentsContent: My first electric kettle lasted for 16 years  My second not even a year.  The on/off switch at the bottom of the kettle broke off.  So I was looking for a kettle that did not have the turn on switch sticking out underneath the handle and that‚Äôs what drew me to this particular kettle.  The temperature setting buttons and on and off button are located on the handle and require  just a touch to turn it on.  I also like the compact base. And the lid opens wide enough to put water in easily.  Overall I would recommend this kettle.

CommentsTitle: Like the appearance! But it is not perfect with the temperature.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 16, 2019
CommentsContent: I like the appearance! But it is not perfect with the temperature. Moreover, when first time I ordered it came with completely wrong temperature sensing. Even when I set on 175F it still boiled the water. I had to replace it. The second one is working much better, but most of the times it stops heating water when temperature around 10-15 degrees higher than requested. So don't expect temperature to be as precise as you see on the buttons. But still this is more than enough to avoid boiling the water every time you want to drink a cup of tea.

CommentsTitle: Quality Product backed by 3 year included warranty
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 14, 2019
CommentsContent: Upon receiving this kettle we noticed that it is very nice quality. The included instructions for coffee/tea heat setting was a plus. Who knew different teas & coffee require different temperature variables. The kettle itself is large at 2.0 L. The spout has a nice scale remover which for us is nice since we have well water. Cleaning is easy as you mix a little vinegar with water and let it sit in the kettle for a short time to get it back to new. The three year warranty included make this a favorable purchase.

CommentsTitle: Best electric kettle we ever bought - year later review
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 6, 2019
CommentsContent: Bought this for the work break room a month ago and we LOVE IT.  We have green, herb and oolong tea drinkers along with french press coffee drinkers.  This is SO simple to use press a button and warm it up coffee.  Add a little cool water to chill it down, then bring it up to temp for green teas.  FAST and easy to use.  The 12 hour keep hot timer is a major bonus compared to our old one.  We have used it for over a 120 hours so far with no problems.  The glass make it easy to tell the water level.  The blue led lights are just cool.Sept 2020 Update: Our home steel kettle died so of course I ordered this one for the house  The one at work is still going strong.  The 12 hour keep hot is now a 4 hour keep hot which is EVEN BETER and more practical.

CommentsTitle: Not safe to use without unattended - Replacement is also not working
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 13, 2021
CommentsContent:
Your browser does not support HTML5 video.










  
  
    
  ¬†I am shocked that this item got high stars.First, it does not shut down after reaching the temperature. My water just kept boiling for more than 10 minutes (the keep warm feature is not on).  I can't even touch the buttons without burning my finger because it was burning hot. Second, while pouring the water into the cup, it leaks the water to the bottom of the kettle. Imagine boiling water is leaking on your foot.Edit: They sent a replacement. I suspect they send the same one. Adding a video to show the second one is also defective. I wish I can give 0 stars.Stay away, friends. This is a scam, and it does not worth 50 bucks.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 18, 2019
CommentsContent: The product arrived very quickly and in a good package. It‚Äôs one of the best kettle around with stainless steel under the lid and filter. I also like the auto shutoff function which reduces concern of forgetting and boiling the water until it evaporates. Overall, it‚Äôs a good product.

CommentsTitle: Beautiful kettle, keeps the water warm for my tea!
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 3, 2020
CommentsContent: I love the blue lights that light up the kettle from the inside, making it easy to see when it is on and running. The whole look is beautiful and modern. It does really well keeping the tea warm but shuts off before it can boil dry (or if it is left on for several hours, like if I left for work and forgot it on). I can turn it on first thing in the morning and then go take a shower, and I know that hot water will be waiting for me when I get out, without having to babysit it. My husband likes that he can pick a different temperature from me - while I like my black tea scalding hot and use the highest setting, he makes instant coffee on the lowest setting possible. This kettle allows for that.I did have a glitch with the kettle and their customer service, for which I knocked down 1-star - it took far too many emails back and forth. They did, in the end, make it right. After a year of owning it, the kettle died. I contacted customer service by phone and did not receive the support I expected. They did much better via email though, honored the 3-year warranty, and replaced the kettle. I am back to enjoying hot tea in the mornings!For those looking to reach customer service: learn from my experience and make sure the email you are using ends in .net and not .com; their email is support@hadineeon.NET. Kettle on!

CommentsTitle: Awesome kettle and company honors warranty
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 28, 2020
CommentsContent: LATEST UPDATE: They apologized for sending me a used kettle and finally sent me a brand-new one to honor the warranty. I‚Äôm happy to finally receive the replacement kettle without any malfunctioning settings.8 MONTH UPDATE: I emailed the company because the kettle is supposed to be under warranty and they agreed to send me a brand-new kettle. I was really pleased with that. What I received was a USED, DIRTY, and DAMAGED kettle inside of an OPENED and RE-TAPED box. I am seriously disgusted. I emailed them requesting a brand-new one, but this is seriously horrendous and extremely inconvenient. I attached photos of what they sent me.7 MONTH UPDATE: I still love this kettle, however, the auto-shut off functions stopped working. It‚Äôs a shame because I really didn‚Äôt think I would experience an issue like this with this kettle, but it‚Äôs happening and now I have to stand in the kitchen to watch the water and the temperature readings are no longer accurate because it just continues to boil rapidly without shutting off at the specific temperature selected. Pretty disappointed that this is happening.ORIGINAL REVIEW: I LOVE this kettle! I only use distilled water in it to prevent hard water buildup and I dry off the inside of the lid and kettle after every use. The different temperature functions are fantastic and it is a very well made product. I read a lot of reviews of other kettles that said that there were problems with the unit not shutting off automatically. This product has great reviews so I went with it and I‚Äôm really glad I did. The auto shut off always works perfect and I‚Äôve never had any problems.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 25, 2019
CommentsContent: Our previous electric kettle was a Capresso, purchased in 2015. We inherited in 2017 and put it through heavy, daily usage. Worked fine, but plastic handle holding the lid simply cracked off and the lid no longer stays on. Searching through reviews at Amazon, I selected the HadinEEon. It had the larger capacity we wanted.Some reviewers found a plastic smell upon opening. We did also, but a few days sitting in a sunny windowsill took care of that completely. Cleaned, dried, and used for the first time, I was pleasant surprised HOW FAST this kettle is. It is much faster than the Capresso even though the capacity is a full 1.5 cups greater with the HadinEEon.UPDATED: Still not a big fan of the many small buttons for differents temps on the handle, but it's been a quick adjustment to using the Start and the Keep Warm buttons. Because the finishing beeps are on the soft side, if I'm busy in the kitchen (range hood working, running water in the sink, etc.), the Keep Warm function has really helped. Once the kettle is lifted off the heating element, all functions are turned off.Note: the cord on this is very, very short. Be certain you can use it easily where you want to plug it in. Also, other reviewers are accurate in saying altho the kettle gives 3 short beeps when water is finished heating, they are indeed very, VERY soft. I was in the kitchen 6' away from the kettle, working on another counter, but did not hear the beeps at all!Based on reviews on Amazon for all the various electric kettles, it seems most of them have problems either within the first 4-6 months, or will go on to last at least a couple of years (all you can expect nowadays, alas). I got the inexpensive 4-yr warranty, just in case, since we use the kettle at least once a day, and often twice daily.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 9, 2020
CommentsContent: This kettle was treated with respect. Boiled twice daily, never once used as a projectile targeting spouse or pets. And then it died. The buttons on the handle no longer work (even though it is receiving power from the base). Every so often a temperature button will flicker back to life and taunt me, before returning to the land of dead appliances. HadinEEon you have thwarted me. I had finally decided to grow up and leave my stove-top kettle behind. I'm sad, I'm $40 poorer, and I'm bored waiting for my stove-top kettle to boil.

CommentsTitle: Best Glass Electric Kettle with 6 Temp Setting
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 26, 2019
CommentsContent: This is one of the most beautiful glass electric kettles I have ever seen. It is sturdy & heavy duty, larger than most (says 8 cups at mid kettle) but seems like you could go as high as 10. Has a built in filter for loose tea. Has 6 push button temp settings, all w a blue backlighting. Has a start/stop button as well as keep warm. Must also add that it reaches preferred temp very quickly. All controls are on top of handle and the base stays in place when placing and removing. Best I‚Äôve seen so far. Most that are comparable to this model run about $100..great value.

CommentsTitle: Didn't even last two weeks, I wanted to love it.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 13, 2020
CommentsContent: My kettle stopped working in under 2 weeks, and it was only used 6 times.  The design, is nice, but ultimately, it has to work.  I'm sending it back and will research more reliable kettles.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States May 2, 2019
CommentsContent: Water temperature is one of the most important factors for a good cup of tea. I drink green tea every day and the kettle immediately makes my regular tea taste better with the recommended setting. I like the fact that it's made of stainless steel and glass, and think it will last a long time.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 6, 2021
CommentsContent: I purchased this in Oct (and this review is being written on 1/6/21). We have 6 disabled adults from 3 generations in my home, and 3 of us are actually autistic. All of us are able to use this and we love it - even the person who won't use the kitchen due to his autism and fear of heated appliances. It replaced one that was 16 years old and kept tripping the power if used at the same time as the microwave. The old one was also fast as lightning - cold to boiling in less than 2 minutes (probably why it tripped the power). So, while this one is a bit slower than that one, I strongly suspect they all are judging by the descriptions of the multitude of kettles I looked at before deciding this one is our guy. It's probably a bit safer this way...lol.We love the various temp choices and the keep warm function is lovely. You can turn it on and come back in a bit and the water is exactly right.The plastic guard also protects the hand holding and pouring with the kettle from the glass so you don't get burned.It's also quite beautiful to look at both when it's heating water and also when it's just sitting on the counter.My only issue is that it's heavy so we can't fill it completely. (Our genetic issue causes joints to dislocate easily, so lifting heavy items can be difficult for us.) However, it's made of borosilicate glass, so I feel that I should have known it would be heavy. I also feel it means that they didn't cheap out on the glass, to be honest.While I spent a bit more than I had originally planned in order to get this model with all the bells and whistles, I'm really glad I did. Even my mother, who is frugal, loves this item.This kettle is a winner for my family who heavily uses it.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States June 3, 2019
CommentsContent: Stopped working after 3 days

CommentsTitle: Larger capacity; aesthetically pleasing look and design
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States May 19, 2019
CommentsContent: I purchased this electric kettle because I wanted a larger capacity kettle and I wanted one that would look nice in our kitchen.  This 2.0 liter kettle holds enough water for both my husband's press pot and my large tea infusion.  It doesn't look that big, though, and fits easily on my countertop under my overhead cabinets.  It heats up water very quickly and has multiple heat settings for different kinds of teas and for presspot coffee and is intuitive and easy to use.  I also like the Keep Warm feature that allows me to pour what I need from the kettle and leave it at the right temp for a few minutes until my husband is ready to pour his.  My favorite thing, though, is that it is a beautiful kettle.  The clear glass and blue light are modern and sleek.  The boiling bubbles of water are mesmerizing.  I had avoided getting a kettle for years because I thought it would just add to the clutter in the kitchen.  On the contrary, this kettle actually makes my kitchen look better.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States May 3, 2020
CommentsContent: Worked great great for about two weeks. But then it started shutting off right after I turned it on. So I cleaned it really good and now it boiled itself nearly dry, water started leaking from it, and the handle was so hot I couldn't touch it. I couldn't even turn it off!! I had to unplug it to get it stop heating. Clearly the temperature sensor is screwed up

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 16, 2020
CommentsContent: First the good: the customer service in this company is exceptional! They responded to my emails promptly and courteously. Now the bad: I liked the concept of this kettle very much. However, as you can see by the photos, the bottom developed rust stains and it happened almost immediately. I cleaned the kettle as per instructions and I could not remove them. I also tried using SOS pads as well as other cleaning methods, and I could seemingly remove them but they came back as soon as I boiled another pot. I only used distilled water as I have well water and, although we have a softener, I wasn't taking any chances. As I said, the customer service is great and they sent me another kettle as soon as I showed them the photos and explained the issue. But, alas, the second one did the same as the first. So, as much as I wanted to love it and hate to leave a bad review, I must.  I would not hesitate to buy another product from this company, though.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 9, 2020
CommentsContent: I will say the water boils quickly and that was the best part of it. It goes downhill from there. After the first use I noticed the calcium on the bottom of the kettle. I was ready to send it back right then. I bought some jugs of distilled water and no calcium build up when using that instead of our tap water. I was willing to deal with that, but my disappointment didnt end there. My husband drinks 2-3 cups of tea to my one and the stay warm feature was the reason for buying this kettle. It worked like a champ the first few times of using it but now the stay warm no longer works. I poured my cup and my husbands cup and set the kettle back on the heat element and when I set it down the kettle shut off. So i waited awhile and started over and same thing happened. I wanted to make sure I wasnt hitting the button by accident. So now it has to go back .. it isnt even a month old.

CommentsTitle: Works well, but I now realize it doesn't have auto-on or one-handed opening
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States June 22, 2020
CommentsContent: The kettle works as advertised and seems to be good quality.  The "keep warm" function works well.  But I have three flaws that make me regret the purchase:1. The kettle does not automatically start heating water when power is applied, no matter what was on when power was removed.  You must plug it in and then push a button regardless of prior state.  My old single-switch kettle would start heating if it was switched on so that I could use a power timer on it, but these buttons are not mechanical.  Plus, this kettle has no delay or timer feature to make up for this.2. The kettle's glass sides shows cloudy water often and also reveals unsightly scale floating in the water.  Of course you should clean the kettle from time to time, but even a little floating scale gives me or others a bad impression, even though it doesn't affect the quality of the tea or coffee much at all.  I think an opaque kettle might be a better option.3.  Opening the lid to fill with water is not as elegant as it could be.  Other kettles enable opening it from the handle, but this kettle requires an entirely non-ergonomic two-handed approach.So in short, this kettle seems great if you don't want auto-on or a delay timer, don't mind seeing into the water, and don't mind two-handed opening.  But perhaps I'll focus on these features next time I buy one.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 18, 2020
CommentsContent: After living abroad and becoming addicted to (as Ted Lasso would say) "brown, garbage water" I have, in the past ten years, found myself in possession of many electric tea kettles but this is the best one of the lot- it has specific settings for a variety of teas (did you know black and green brew best at different temperatures?) AND, perhaps best of all, there are a couple of below boiling settings that will allow you to fill up your evening hot water bottle without compromising the rubber. In any event, I rarely write reviews but this is purchase that, even though I deliberated for a while as the price point is high, I definitely recommend and would purchase again. Plus the blue lights and clear glass are pretty...there is something satisfying about watching your water boil and bubble.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States April 24, 2020
CommentsContent: My lid broke in less than a monthThe glass clouded over in less than a monthThe automatic shut-off failed and the base melted in less than two monthsIf you give this kettle a 5 star review they will send you a free inexpensive productThe kettle is cheap and only lasts about two months -- it merits a 1 star review not 5 starBuyer beware

CommentsTitle: Love the temp control - a MUST!
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States June 25, 2019
CommentsContent: My last kettle lasted less than a year, so the search began.  I decided I would spend a little more money on a superior product.  I love the features this kettle has - I love match, my daughter drinks black and my husband alternates with a french press now and again so the temperature control is HUGE for us.  It's quieter and easier to clean than my previous kettle.  I've loved it until I noticed a little leak coming from the handle.  You have to love how easy Amazon makes it to return or exchange products.  I noted it on my account, and the very next day I had a replacement.  This unit does not seem to leak, so we look forward to a nice, long lasting relationship with this unit.

CommentsTitle: At long last love! Our favorite electric kettle.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 5, 2020
CommentsContent: This is the fourth ‚Äúcordless electric kettle I‚Äôve ordered from Amazon, but by far the best. I‚Äôve now learned that reviews do matter, and don‚Äôt chintz, because you get what you pay for.  In brief, we love this HadinEEon cordless kettle. The size, capacity, insulation, and clarity of the carafe are excellent, making it quick and easy to fill with just the right amount of water. (The makers advise against brewing tea with tea bags in the water inside; rather, pour the hot water into a separate tea pot or cups.)  You lift the hinged lid by pulling gently up and back with a fingertip notch, which puts no stress on the lid and protects your hand from exposure to steam from the spout. I like this design much better than the push-button pop-top on our previous kettle, which just stopped ‚Äúpopping‚Äù one day and couldn‚Äôt be revived.  The HadinEEon kettle has 6 temperature settings to select, right in the handle above your grip, labeled with degrees Fahrenheit and examples: for hot tea, we always choose ‚Äú190/Oolong.‚Äù The kettle heats the water quickly to your setting, then shuts itself off.  A Keep Warm button is handy for making that second cup of tea with remaining hot water.  In use, the kettle is safe and will not expose your hands to direct heat. The lid hinges down and snaps securely.  Steam will escape upward from the spout, so don‚Äôt place the kettle directly beneath cabinets, shelves or lights you don‚Äôt want to get damp.  The carafe is ‚Äúsimple‚Äù though not ‚Äúeasy‚Äù to clean, a tad cumbersome to suds the inside and rinse without jostling the lid. So I recommend using a long-handled or bottle brush. But it‚Äôs much easier just to heat water plus a little vinegar in the carafe, then dump the water and rinse it carefully out.  Note that the carafe itself is not ‚Äúcordless,‚Äù but rests flush on a flat base containing the separate heating unit, which itself plugs into an electrical outlet.  The carafe must be set *carefully* on the spindle in the center of this base.  Repeatedly wobbling it when putting it in place might wear down the connection.  But of all the kettles we‚Äôve purchased, this spindle is the largest, sturdiest, and easiest to connect to the carafe.  Note: The cord between the base and outlet is very short!  Luckily our wall outlet is already precisely where we need to hook up our coffee maker and this water kettle, so the cord is just the right length without the need for extra, precarious cords.  If your own nearest outlet is more than 2 feet away from the ideal countertop location, you‚Äôll need to use an extension cord safe for small appliances, such as for a toaster.  In sum, we love this cordless electric kettle from HadinEEon. Our only lingering question is how to pronounce HadinEEon!

CommentsTitle: Good Kettle. No problems so far. Sketchy review process though.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 3, 2020
CommentsContent: It does what It's supposed to do. I like the different temperature settings. The blue lights look nice. It's fun to watch the water boil. The only things that keep it from being perfect are that it's not very fast. I've used other kettles that heated water in half the time. It also sometimes has to stop and start a few times to hone in on a specific temperature.But those are minor issues. I'm very pleased with it. Would recommend.Update: I wrote this review because I got a card in the mail offering me $20 in amazon money for an honest review. So I wrote this review, saying that it was a good kettle but not perfect. Instead of the promised gift card I was told that I could have a $30 gift card if I changed my review from four stars to five, and credit their excellent customer service. I thought about it but eventually declined. That seemed too sketchy.Now months later they're emailing me about changing the review to 5 stars. So, I guess don't trust all those five star reviews. It's a fine kettle, I've enjoyed using it, had no problems, would recommend it to others. But the whole paying people only for five star reviews, that's a bit much. I can't even say if their customer service is that great, all I've had contact with is their overbearing marketing team.

CommentsTitle: Scales up quickly even with bottled water
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 8, 2020
CommentsContent: I use bottled water, but after only a few days the water in the kettle had white particles floating around in it and staining the bottom of the kettle. The filter on the spout doesn't filter these out.I thought the temperature options were fun but ended up using only the hottest temp as that is the only one that heats up straightaway without the stupid start/stop feature of the others that make the cooler temps longer to complete.Despite the fancy buttons for the temperature on the handle, the lid opener is clunky and located on top of the kettle so it's hot if you open it after boiling the kettle. Also, closing it is hard.Noisier than I expected too.Altogether a disappointing experience.

CommentsTitle: Great Electric Kettle - Fast - Great Warranty - Except*
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 14, 2020
CommentsContent: I purchased the HadinEEon Variable Temperature Electric Kettle, 1200W Electric Tea Kettle, 8 Big Cups 2.0L Kettle.The Delivery was exceptionally fast. I ordered on a Saturday and received it on Monday (two days). OK I tried out the electric kettle and it worked very well on all temperature settings, along with the keep warm setting.My concern before my purchasing was not recognizing the brand name and additionally the location of the temperature buttons on the handle. However after using the product I was impressed with the way it operates and looks well made. The heat setting buttons do not interfere with my hands (fingers) when pouring. I can also easily reach into the unit to clean when needed. When the water is fully heated there is a very faint beep sound from the unit. I added a few photos to let you see how it looks and also to see the warranty data. What sold me to buy this particular unit was that it offers a 3 year parts and labor warranty and a two year money back guarantee (see photo of box and product insert and manual). Time will tell but I feel I made a good purchase.. *4 Stars ‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏èCons:1) You need to pour slowly as water will leak from the area if poured to quickly. Pour slower and it‚Äôs fine.2) Label (stencil) the other side of the glass kettle with measurements as it‚Äôs slightly inconvenient to keep turning the kettle around to see the kettle level markings.I still am enjoying this unit but with slight adjustments to my routine from my previous electric kettle, so I lowered my score from a *Five + to a *Four star score.. Sincerely MikeB

CommentsTitle: Perfect Size, Best Settings and Happy buyer
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States April 1, 2021
CommentsContent: Over the last year I have focused on eliminating how much/long we use our bigger kitchen appliances like the stove as well cutting my time in the kitchen. This Kettle has been a game changer for us. I primary use this to boil water when making anything that requires bring your water to a boil first. I love the fact that this kettle brings your water to a boil in little to no time. I typically transfer it to my pot on the stove and finish cooking. It cuts so much time and uses less energy which is simply a win for our house hold. I am also a heavy tea drinker and I love that this allows you to boil water to the perfect temperature depending on the type (green, black, etc) tea you are drinking. Let me note, I can tell a difference using these settings for the proper type of tea. The last feature I want to note is the "Stay warm" this is every mama's dream come true who have littles who will walk in the kitchen and request your attention. I love the fact that when I return I can pickup where I left off.I kettle seems extremely sturdy and takes up little space if you choose to leave it our. If you want to store it it stores easily under the cabinet as well as most upper cabinets which I also like.  After reviewing many different kettles and sizes I am happy I decided to purchase this one and after two months of constant use I can say this is the one you want to purchase hands down.

CommentsTitle: The Best Kettle I've Ever Owned
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 4, 2020
CommentsContent: The title says it all: This is the Best Kettle I've ever owned!  And mind you, I've owned and replaced quite a bit of electric kettles in my life.  Admittedly, this is the first glass kettle I've owned, and I was pretty hesitant to switch over from my tried and true stainless steel kettle to glass.  But after my last Stainless Steel kettle began to discolor, (and left the heated water with a disgusting metallic taste), less than a year after receiving it - despite following the care directions to a tee - I knew I had to find a better alternative.After reviewing a bunch of glass kettles on Amazon, I was completely blown away by all the positive reviews left for the HadEEon electric kettle that I had to get it.  And boy does it not disappoint!  Not only is the kettle itself absolutely beautiful with a serene blue light illuminating the water while it's heating, but it heats the water insanely fast.  Unlike my other kettle, this kettle allows you to choose the exact heated temperature of the water - which is perfect for tea drinkers like me as water temperatures can differ depending on the type of tea being drunken.Fully washing the kettle itself is much easier than any other kettle I've owned.  Due to the large opening, it's easy to fully wash the kettle when needed without having to reach for a long dish brush - or nearly cutting your wrist open due to a narrow metal top.I highly doubt I'll ever return to a standard stainless steel kettle again, and I'm pretty sure that if anything ever happens to this kettle, I'll be happy to purchase the exact same brand without hesitation.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 26, 2021
CommentsContent:
Your browser does not support HTML5 video.










  
  
    
  ¬†Do. Not.  Buy this brand.So many regrets......it stopped working 3 weeks in.U may think, oh it‚Äôs just defective for her.... no! Customer Service was so ready to give me back my money and accept this return.Their only option is to return to them for refund. They will not honor warrant that comes with product.At this point, I think they accept returns so they can resell defective products.If you want to like a kettle then have it stop heating water.. on any setting... buy this. If you want disappointment on a cold day... buy this.If u love to waste time and money, but this one..... if not.DO NOT BUY THIS KETTLE!!! It‚Äôs a waste!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 3, 2021
CommentsContent: I bought this kettle in July. 6 months it started boiling uncomfortably by evaporating all the water and putting my family in a very unsafe situation. Good thing we are home to unplug the kettle. I have never had a kettle going bad in 6 months. Do yourself a favor and look for more reputable and tested brands.I would like to add to this review -  about 2 weeks ago I was contacted by the manufacturer asking me how they can help me with my experience. I told them I already purchased a new kettle from a more reliable brand. Then they offered me $100. I thought they were trying to reimburse me for my additional expense and said I would accept their refund. Then they asked me to remove my comment and only after that they will pay me $100. I sent them an email stating that their Kettle is a safety hazard and put my family, my house and my neighbors in a safety situation if I was not home when the kettle started boiling at a high temperature on its own. I also told them that I would be willing to modify my comment if they told me what is being done to remedy the situation with their kettle so future buyers are safe. I never heard from them again. Please be very careful with this kettle as I am not the only one who had this safety issue.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 20, 2020
CommentsContent: I am using my new kettle today for the first time.  Of course, it is shiny and new, but I am impressed by the elegant design.  I wondered if it would be too heavy, but I wanted a larger kettle anyway.  The placement and shape of the handle makes it quite comfortable and easy to maneuver, even though it is much bigger than my old kettle.  I also really enjoy the glass body with the led lighting around the bottom when it is heating.  It actually makes "watching water boil" entertaining!I enjoy many different types of hot drinks, and I appreciate the variable heat feature on this appliance.  Some flavors of tea or coffee are released better with lower temperatures, and this kettle gives me that option.It is very quick. I did not time the heatings, but I was surprised at how quickly it reached boiling, even though it contains almost eight cups of water.This kettle also has a "keep warm" feature, which I anticipate using quite often.  Especially if several people are having hot drinks, it will be very nice to have the hot water available without having to re-heat the kettle each time.As I said, this is my first day to use my new kettle, so I really haven't found anything negative to say about it.  We will see how durable it is, and if it continues to perform as well in future as it is today.Overall, I would rate this product as an excellent purchase, and would recommend it to anyone who enjoys hot drinks.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States June 11, 2019
CommentsContent: My previous kettle from a different seller failed after 1 yr. I had enjoyed the variable temperature setting but found few vendors that supported this. The HadinEEon has variable temperature support and a 3 year warranty so I ordered it. It is working well, but a few items that are not as good as the previous kettle:  the shape is a bit funny and more difficult to handle that one that is taller and thinner. To fill the kettle is not as easy - the lid needs to be snapped back and then forcibly closed. I worry that it will wear out. The beep when the temperature has been reached is very hard to hear. Otherwise, great!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States June 9, 2020
CommentsContent: I purchased my first kettle July, 2019 and used it for awhile until one day my cappuccino got cold so I decided to put it in the pot and heat it up (since I didn't want to use a microwave and alter the taste, etc) - well I was getting ready for work and didn't stand there and watch it. when I came back it was boiling over - the sugars I assume in the cappuccino got bubbly and boiled over so when I took the pot off the base the base has cappuccino on it and I ruined my pot - no kidding.  I do not fault the manufacturer. I didn't read the directions, so perhaps the directions say not to use a sugary liquid in the pot? I don't know - anyway  #1 I should not have walked off, #2 I should not have put anything in there with sugar that could boil over.My best advice is just to ONLY use it for WATER and that takes care of any guess work.  After I ruined the first pot - it did last me a whole 6 months before I managed to find a way to ruin a perfectly great device. I bought my second pot - did not hesitate.  Purchased my second pot Jan, 2020 and have only used it for water and it is working fine. It is hands down my favorite addition to the kitchen - no more using the microwave to heat water. I know that sounds crazy but I use filtered water, so I could use hot water out of the tap, but that is not filtered, so it makes more sense to continue to filter my water and then use this pot to heat it up - its way faster that putting it in a sauce pan on the stove.Make things super simple. Can use it for hot drinks but also for cooking (e.g instant mashed potatoes, and other things).What I really like about it too are the different temperature suggestions for tea. I have all kinds of hot teas I drink and it helps to have an idea what temperature to not go over for the type of tea you are about to brew (e.g, delicate, green, white oolong) and there is a setting for french press or black.Since we also use a french press - this pot was perfect and I don't have to look up what temperature to stop at or set it at each time. This clever device is so handy and helpful. I just love it.I would definitely recommend and buy another one again when this one wears out.I would still give it a five stars even though I ruined the first pot - I felt like it was my own fault for either not reading the directions or for walking off - so for whatever its worth - its still a great kitchen appliance.

CommentsTitle: Great Kettle! Worth spending a little more!
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 24, 2021
CommentsContent: I've owned several electric kettles over the last 10 yrs. Frankly, like toasters these days, they are not built to last...This time I decided to spend a little more. I think it was worth it. It feels like it is better made, heartier. I like the idea of the different water temperatures although I have not found the need to use yet since I use for black tea or plain boiled water primarily. Follow the directions for cleaning prior to use. It is a MUST. They are all treated with some horrible chemicals, so cleaning before using very important.It has a a wide opening. The top flips open so you could put your hand in. Other kettles often only partially open and noticed is a con in many other kettle reviews. Gives a couple of unobtrusive beeps when done. My only other common sense comment would be if you have filled it more than half way, advise against aggressively pouring out because it will spill. That is true of other kettles as well. Probably due to the filter spout insert. Regardless, that may be a safety feature to keep from over pouring and burning yourself.I recommend this kettle and would buy again or for someone else.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 15, 2020
CommentsContent: Just bought a kettle with a sticker inside that I won 20 $. Who put it on the inside of the kettle?? Don't how to remove sticker residue now. Not sure if it's safe to drink water that was boiled with the glue on the kettle.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 28, 2020
CommentsContent: I use this kettle almost every day for coffee, tea, and whatever else needs hot water.Usage is simple: press the button for the heat setting that you want (Delicate, Green, White, Oolong, French Press, Black), and then press Start / Stop. You can also press Keep Warm if you'd like the kettle to hold the temperature for a 10 minutes or so. The water will glow blue when the kettle is heating and the light will turn off when it is cooling. It will beep once the desired temperature is reached.The temperature is fairly accurate (194 degrees measured at French Press 200 degree mode) and heating is pretty quick (2:40 to boil 2 cups of water from 76 degree room temperature).My last kettle died because water penetrated the control buttons, which were located on the base of the heater. This kettle has a more compact base and the controls are not in danger of major spills.I only have one complaint: the top lid needs to be securely snapped or water will sometimes splash outside of the spout. Make sure that you snap it firmly or you may spill when pouring quickly.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 20, 2019
CommentsContent: Only time will tell how good of a kettle this is...my last kettle (other brand) lasted only 3 years.  The temperature setting is very nice and so is the glass kettle.  A free gift was offered for writing this review, however the email sent to me to ask which gift I wanted also asked me to add another star to my review.  So far I like the kettle but that made me feel less confident in other reviews.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 2, 2020
CommentsContent: This kettle is great. Upon opening the box, it was a bit larger than I had anticipated. I set it up and boiled water in it and dumped it per the instructions. I then filled the kettle to the max line, hit 212 degrees, and the 2L of water boiled in approximately 4-5 Minutes.There is a faint beeping when the water reaches the desired temperature, which was difficult to hear in my very loud home, but I would imagine it is easily heard in the wee hours of the morning when its early and you need that Tea/Coffee. Along with the beep, the LED lights shut off which also notify you.The LED lights are impressive and make the kettle look very cool and modern. I really liked that feature.The buttons are nice and easily pressed with very straightforward instructions.I have EXTREMELY hard water and have to descale anything that uses water regularly, if not replace altogether. I can already tell that there is scaling starting to form on the bottom. I would imagine a weekly vinegar brew will be necessary, but again, this is no fault of the product.All in all, I really like this kettle and appreciate the warranty that comes with it.Thanks Hadineeon! I love my kettle!

CommentsTitle: Well made tea kettle.  Works like it should. Excellent temp controls.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States April 1, 2021
CommentsContent: This tea kettle is well made and works well.  We use it daily and it has been put through its paces.  The temperature control is great.  the only "downside" is not due to the kettle, it is the quality of water you put in.  If you have water with a lot of dissolved solids you will have to clean this regularly.  It is not overly difficult but a slight scale build-up will occur over time.  There is a screen mesh that prevents any loose sediment from getting into your drink should you not clean it but it is best to keep it clean.The base is solid and it heats water pretty quickly.  The best part is the temperature control, it will maintain the water temp you set if you prefer for 4 hours.  Nice for warm-ups.You do have to be careful not to damage the glass.  It is pretty rugged but it is glass.  I like it better than metal or non-see-thru carafes because you can see when it is clean.All in all, it is a very nice electric kettle.  Use quality filtered water and this will make you an excellent cup of tea.

CommentsTitle: Nice quality, accurate and even heat distribution, and easy to use.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 15, 2020
CommentsContent: This is actually the third style of kettle I've gotten and it is my favorite.  I've gotten one with the rotary dial but it was difficult to dial in the temperature each time; I also got one that you can enter in the exact temperature but I didn't feel safe using it as the control pad generated heat when not in use and it also took a little extra effort to set the temperature each time I wanted to change the type of tea I was making.  The buttons on this one are actually easier and faster to use.  Quality is higher than expected making this a good value.  The keep warm feature is nice because I often get distracted by the dog or kids while making tea.  And of course it's accuracy....within 5 degrees every single time which is what I was looking for.  I got tired of using an instant thermometer every time and bought this kettle.  So happy I did.  Love the slightly larger size too.  Perfect for my needs.  The tapered shape seems to help evenly distribute the heat  through the entire kettle also.  Love having six different settings.  I use them all!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 17, 2020
CommentsContent: Does exactly what I needed. Convenient to have the temperature presets; I could imagine wanting to have finer control over precise temperatures, but honestly I can't imagine what I could use that for, and it would probably involve more time to punch in than the very simple interface it currently has.The blue LED lights on the bottom look great as the water is heating. If you use a setting other than full-boil/"black" tea, then once it reaches a certain point it will stop heating (and the lights go off), allowing the water to cool (or rather, to heat more slowly, using only whatever heat energy is still on the hot plate), and then turn on again, alternating back and forth with about 1-to-2-second "on" cycles, until it's satisfied with the temperature, and beeps 6 times. The beeps are plenty audible, though I might wish them to be a tad louder when I have a lot of white noise going on, such as a "portable" AC unit going full blast, with the stove fan on. Even then, I was able to hear it fine if I was nearby.

CommentsTitle: Great for tea, coffee, heating water for the baby's milk!
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States June 5, 2020
CommentsContent: Really neat way to warm water! Preset buttons work well to get your water to the exact temperature you need for coffees and teas. I like the glass wall on this one so I can see what's going on inside of the pot! Makes for a nice experience with the neat lighting they put inside!I had a different brand unit, a Cuisinart one that was solid brushed stainless steel and I could not see inside to identify when there was a calcium build-up. This one is much better for that reason. Also the opening on this one is much larger making it easier to clean.One downside I have noticed so far are because of the shape of the mouth I cannot use this one to get water from my refrigerator filter built into my refrigerator door. That's not a deal-breaker though I just use a cup to fill it.The other thing I am a little bit nervous about are these buttons. They just feel soft, like they will wear quickly, but I could be wrong about that so I will update this review if they do.Please note I was given this unit in exchange for a review. I have tried not to let that affect my partiality.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 19, 2019
CommentsContent: First, I've only had this thing for two days so keep that in mind.  If it blows up tomorrow I'll append my review, but keep in mind it has a three year warranty.Now, for what you want to know:It's big; eight cups is a lot.  That's good for me because I brew a lot of iced tea.  But if you're looking for something petite, this is not for you.  Of course you don't have to fill it up, but it's large compared to most others I've seen.It keeps the water at the temperature you select; I tested it with my kitchen thermometer and it works.  I did not test it for twelve hours, but I tested the warming feature.It get's hot quickly; I didn't time it, but it does.The individual temperature settings work as well or better than I thought they would; they are close most of the time.  This may change as the machine is used; I don't know.  But I tested them.  The 160 setting hit 156 and stayed there.  175 was closer to 170.  185 stayed at around 181.  200 hit it right on the money.  212; it boiled aggressively.  Perfect, no.  But close enough for me.  I think to get perfect precision you'd have to pay through the nose.I like the fact that the manufacturer included recommended temperatures for brewing a long list of teas and stuff. No big deal, but thoughtful.Construction is not industrial strength.  If you don't abuse it I suspect it will be fine.  It doesn't feel flimsy, just lightweight.  Treat it like glass (oh, yeah, it IS glass) and it should hold up well.  And you have the warranty.One more thing, I read a negative review whining that the company bribed him/her to write a 5-star review.  That's not exactly true.  There is an insert in the paperwork that says if you will write a review and forward the documentation of purchase and review to the company they will give you one of six gifts.  One of the gifts is a $10 Amazon gift card.  Nowhere in the offer does it say you have to give a great review, or even a good one; just tell people what you think.My thinking at this point is just that the company thinks they have a good product.  But if I don't get my $10 you'll hear about it.

CommentsTitle: Broke after 4th month of intermittent use... Do not buy!
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 17, 2020
CommentsContent: It did work quite well for the first 3 months of use (not every single day use), however for the last month, it seemed to have some issues occasionally and wouldn't always turn on.  Finally quit completely 2 days ago. My previous Hamilton Beach electric kettle worked great for 3 years... This one worked great for 3 months... Not impressed.  For the extra cost of this kettle, you could get 2 kettles that will last you about 6 years combined. I would not buy this kettle again.

CommentsTitle: Kettle has been great and is used daily since working at home
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 31, 2020
CommentsContent: Once I started working at home everyday back in March 2020 I quickly discovered that I missed the hot water always available at the office.  I looked to get a water kettle soon after.I do not drink coffee but instead I add some caffeinated flavoring (such as Mio) to hot water and use that as my pick-me-up in the morning.  Either that or hot chocolate added to hot water.  I am very happy that I decided on this model.  I like that it is see-through so I always know the level of water remaining and makes it easy to add water without overfilling.  The light at the base of the kettle lets me know it is heating and keeping the water hot.The main reason I picked this model is because it allows the user to choose the temperature of water it heats to.  I do not like scalding hot water and many kettles will heat to boiling temps and I have to wait until it cools down a bit. This has 6 different choices for how hot it gets the water and is a feature I really appreciate. I understand that certain coffees and teas are best served at various temperatures so that feature would be helpful to most people I am sure.I also really love the feature that has the kettle keeping the water steady at my chosen temperature for 4 hours.  That way I can just start it up as soon as I walk in to the kitchen in the morning and I can come back to it several times before lunch and refill again knowing that it will be at the right temp for me.It has been going strong for 9 months now with regular use.  I am very happy that I chose this kettle and would recommend it to whomever is looking for one.

CommentsTitle: Follow up to our previous review
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 28, 2020
CommentsContent: Likes:auto shut off feature, temperature settings for each type of tea, keep warm feature, it also aesthetically pleasing to watch the water boil.Dislike:We bought the teapot in Dec 2019 and in March 2020, the cheap plastic filter, attached to the front spout, broke and we found bits in the water.Button on the top for the closure is broken also.We'll go back to a known brand.
