This was not worth the money.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States June 10, 2020
CommentsContent: I had a plastic kettle I previously bought from Amazon during Prime day years ago, and loved. I loved it because it let me pick the temperature of the water, based off the type of tea I was making, which is quite often in my household. When my other kettle broke, I went to replace it with the same model, but found out that over the years the other company was cutting corners by making the kettle with cheaper products (that also broke faster) and raised the price of the unit. So began my new kettle search. I love the fact that this kettle is glass, better for me and the environment. The kettle holds SO much water. I can now easily boil large quantities of water, for my summer iced tea, in one go instead of having to empty and refill 3 or 4 times. The blue light is very pretty, as others have mentioned, and is a great indicator (especially at night) when the water is done boiling. This is a kettle that is on the larger size, which is great for me, and looks good on my counter. I would recommend purchasing this kettle if you're on the fence..

CommentsTitle: Nice Kettle but be Careful of the Stay Warm Feature
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States May 27, 2020
CommentsContent: The Kettle heats water as described. I paid the extra for this Kettle because of the stay warm feature. The stay warm feature works by bring your water up to the temperature you choose and then when it drops below a certain point it heats it back up to your set temp over and over again. We use the high setting but had to stop using the stay warm feature because once, it kept reheating to the point that the water was almost completely gone (less than 1 inch in the kettle) with the remaining water having a strong metallic taste and a second time it boiled the water over and over again until it was completely evaporated. I worry that had I forgotten about it for longer the water would have completely evaporated and the heating element may have started a fire.

CommentsTitle: very poor quality! don't buy it otherwise some unknown chemicals will be added to your daily drink
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 10, 2020
CommentsContent: I started use this kettle for my daily hot ware.  At first it worked fine, and added a beautiful color in our kitchen. However I was stunted less than three weeks later. I saw some dark yellow spots inside the kettle, one sat on the bottom, another two sat on the circle where the glass meets the bottom. They really look like rust. I was really shocked because the kettle makes me drink a lot of unknown element. My first guess is that the manufacture used non-stainless steel instead of  stainless steel to save money, of course, his own money. I have returned it. I do hope that Amazon should have checked product quality and the manufacture's reputation before providing platform for them.

CommentsTitle: Look no further. This is the one you should buy.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 2, 2019
CommentsContent: I needed one of these for my wife who drinks tea. She was heating water on the stove and forgot about it enough times that we both thought it would be a good idea to get an electric kettle. We are very happy with this purchase. Delivery was fast. The box was pristine. It's very simple to use. The reason you should buy this one in particular is the keep warm feature which most of the other electric kettles do not have. If you have the keep warm feature you can turn the kettle on and walk away for up to 12 hours, and the water will be at the temperature you set it for. Without that feature any kettle will simply turn off when it reaches the set temperature and begin to cool off, and you might have to cycle it again by the time you get back. It also holds a full 2 liters, most of the others are a little smaller. This one wasn't the least expensive, but the keep warm, the extra size, and the 3 year warranty and 1 year money back guarantee are worth more. Great gift idea for anyone you know that needs hot water for things like tea.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States June 19, 2020
CommentsContent: This pot replaced another model I've had for years and it is such a total upgrade! I love that it is clear and I can easily see the water level. It also holds more water than my other pot without an increased footprint. My old pot did not have different temps or a keep warm function and now I don't know how I lived without those features. I can bring water to the correct temp for specific teas and keep it there. I don't have to guess at how hot it is or keep waiting for the water to heat up again when I want to make another cup. Despite the additional features it is still easy to use. I have an adult son with Down Syndrome that enjoys a cup of hot cocoa every night and he likes making it himself. I was afraid the additional settings would get too confusing for him, but after trying out a few temps we decided on the one he liked best and he has no trouble using it to warm up his water. The controls are super easy and intuitive. It is also very easy to clean - much easier than my old pot because of the wider opening and because it is clear so I can actually see what I'm doing better. It also heats up quickly.  I've only had it a week but we've used it every  day, multiple times a day and I really love it.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 10, 2020
CommentsContent:
Your browser does not support HTML5 video.










  
  
    
  ¬†At least I think it is as it's still been pretty warm out in Cali! However, I am ready now with this convenience item. I've been wanting to try an electric kettle and replace my old stove top one that leaks when it boils so decided to test this one out.*PROS: Fast heat - you can see the bubbles fairly quickly once you've pressed start, large capacity (8 cups), looks nice on the counter, variable temp settings to give your different beverages optimal taste & a stay warm feature if you need to keep hot water for a length of time.*CONS: I wish the lid came off all the way as I think that would make it even easier to clean, the stay warm feature expires after 20 seconds once you remove from base which seems short and you feel a bit rushed, the lighting is cute but some might find it gimmicky - however, it's helpful in letting you know when it's on.BOTTOM LINE: I really like this electric kettle and will be using it a lot in the coming cold months.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 30, 2021
CommentsContent: I bought this because I kept starting my gas fire kettle and then forgetting about it.  I was concerned there was going to be a fire.  This blue light kettle device had high ratings.  I have been very happy with it.  I use it almost every day.  It takes just a few minutes to boil water.  I like the multiple heat settings but for me I always use it at the 212 degree setting.  I never use the "keep warm" feature because I might forget and boil off all my water.  The blue light looks really cool.  Just be careful because it does use a lot of electricity, I ran it and a toaster and the microwave at the same time and tripped a circuit breaker.  But that is not a negative just something to be cautious about.  Anyway this has been a very useful device to me, and like I said I use it almost every day and most days more than once.  It is intuitive to use, my daughter came home and used it no problem.  Useful device, thank you.

CommentsTitle: Best Kettle; Most Features & Visually Appealing!
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 25, 2020
CommentsContent: I just moved into my own apartment after 8 years of renting rooms in other people's houses. This kettle was the FIRST thing I purchased on Amazon for my new space, even before I actually moved in! (Sheltering at a friend's house for weeks. #thankscovid19) From April 30th to today -- nearly 3 months, I have used this kettle EVERY. SINGLE. DAY., no exaggeration. I use it for tea (LOVE that it has different temperature settings for more delicate teas!), and for boiling water I need to make bouillon with quickly when the soup I'm making gets too thick. This kettle is fast!I also love the Keep Warm function, which by the way doesn't really mean "warm," it means whatever temperature you have it set at! I know Myself, and sometimes I put the water on for tea, then get sidetracked and forget about it for an hour - or 2, or 3, or... you get the idea. If I've pushed the keep warm button, though, the water is as piping hot as it was when it first reached temperature. There are absolutely no cons to this kettle. Oh! Oh! Oh! I almost forgot! I also love that the base isn't attached to the kettle like many I've seen. You can take the kettle where you need it, set it down on the counter or table without worrying about the heating element, which is part of the base.Buy this kettle; I predict you'll be very happy you did. Stay safe, everyone!

CommentsTitle: Much better than the stainless steel kettle it replaced
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 30, 2021
CommentsContent: We had a name brand stainless steel electric kettle from the BB&B store and it was so convenient.  Liked everything about it except that the only way to see the level was through a small glass leveling tube on the side and there is really no way to clean that part.  Decided to get a glass kettle so you can see and clean everything.  After comparing kettles this one seemed to have the most consistent positive reviews, but was a little more expensive I believe for the extra temp options and the cool LED's.  The options are nice, but really we just wanted a well built and reliable one so were willing to pay a little extra for it.  We've had it a couple months and it's been great.  The whole glass kettle lights up to let you know it's on, and the different temp options are actually pretty nice.  I like there are no tubes or areas that are hard to clean so clean up is a breeze.  So far this is the perfect electric kettle.

CommentsTitle: Excellent electric kettle! Worth the price for the features you get!
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 8, 2020
CommentsContent: I received the HadinEEon Variable Temperature Electric Kettle as a Christmas present. I like to drink green tea, but getting the temperature right requires watching the kettle to prevent it from reaching a full boil or the tea will turn out bitter. This wonderful kettle allows me to set the perfect temperature for different teas and walk away. There‚Äôs also a handy ‚Äòkeep warm‚Äô function in case I‚Äôm distracted and don‚Äôt get to pour for a few minutes, or for hours!I had never thought about using an electric kettle until we spent a couple of weeks in the UK and Ireland. Each flat where we stayed had a basic electric kettle and I was impressed by how fast they worked. I loved using them. This model is the luxury version, and worth every penny!The only thing I would change is to make the chime a bit louder. I only hear it if I wait and specifically listen for it.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 29, 2019
CommentsContent: It worked fine at the beginning, but it stopped working after 3 months.  Not worth the money.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States June 28, 2019
CommentsContent: This teapot has the perfect temperature right on the teapot to brew your tea and heat water for instant coffee.  Best teapot I have owned. I love that you can see how much water is in the pot and the measurements on the side of the glass.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 11, 2020
CommentsContent: I wanted to wait a bit before reviewing this kettle so that I could give an accurate review. I have been using this daily since it arrived and we love it. The labels on the buttons help us know what temp to brew at but - even more useful is the guide chart in the instruction booklet because it gives even more varieties of tea and which temp to choose for them. It is compact on my counter even though it has a large water capacity and it is super pretty- love the blue lights. The only con I can give you is that I wish the keep warm function had a better time window... I will explain, it only remembers to keep warm at the temp you choose if you put it back on the base within a 20 second window. Maybe I am just slow, but for me it takes a bit longer to pour my water and replace the pot on the base. Just extending that to 30 seconds would make a huge difference for me personally. Other than that - we have really enjoyed our tea so much more with the ability to choose the temperature and this kettle has been amazing. I de-scaled it for the first time today and it cleaned up like a breeze. So glad we decided to take the plunge on this one!

CommentsTitle: It does what it should and looks good doing it
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 13, 2020
CommentsContent: I'm no pro when it comes to electric kettles but I'm quite happy with this one. It's easy to use, I like that there's a temp guide for brewing different types of tea in the instructions. It looks good with my other appliances. It's not too big but boy is that cord short. It's a good safety feature. Despite being totally for show I enjoy the blue light that comes on when you use it. I'm a child of the 80's, if it lights up that gives it automatic cool points. Before I got this in was boiling my tea water in a pot on the stove like a savage. Is this a first world problem, absolutely. Did this product solve that problem? Yes it did. I can finally earn my tea ‚òïÔ∏è Brewing merit badge. No quarantine in New England would be complete without the proper brewing tech. The boiling time is basically the same as stovetop but I don't have to worry about it boiling over, I can leave the room and even if I forget about it I won't end up a burned pot and a screaming fire alarm.

CommentsTitle: I'd buy this again, or give this as a gift. Excellent value for the price
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 16, 2020
CommentsContent: The kettle arrived on time and well-packaged. The labels for temps also tea types and a setting for French press.  Yaay!  The kettle package included a note about the lights going off and on as the unit reaches temp.  That note is accurate.  I've used it about 5 times since receiving it and no hitches.  I'm using it with a GE reverse osmosis water source and I can easily fit the kettle under the spout. I have small adult hands and will be able to reach inside, if needed.I also like that there's no plastic with the boiling part. Since it's a glass kettle, no plastic is used for the viewing window.  (There's a few less chemicals in the body!)I'm trying out the "Keep warm" feature today. If I don't update the review, that means the feature is still working awesomely.I recommend it for its performance and at this time of writing, the price and value compared to other kettles with similar temp features is a definite yes!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 1, 2020
CommentsContent: I purchased this three months ago after I got good and sick of my other electric water kettle leaking from the bottom. I chose the HadinEEon because of the size and the variable temps. When I received it, it was packed well and I was able to pull it out if the box, wash, and fill with water. Used it right away. It takes longer than my previous kettle to boil water because it holds more water. However, it works great. All the different temps work just fine, although I have not used a thermometer to check for accuracy. The blue light is lovely to look at in the middle of the night when everyone else is asleep and I am making tea.The only drawback is that the bottom of the unit, between the borosilicate glass and the metal, has discolored. It is supposed to be made from stainless steel so I am not sure how it happened, but it did...see pic. This, however, has not changed the product quality, just the beauty.The size is a full 8 cups with variable temperature control. It's exactly as I expected. I would purchase again or give as a gift.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States April 2, 2021
CommentsContent: I had been using all metal kettle to boil water for tea. Plain water from that kettle had a metallic taste to it (the taste I am trying to describe still exists with this kettle but it seems less pronounced). I began to look for a glass kettle for this reason, and because a documentary leads me to think a glass kettle would be better for health. I paid more to get this kettle from my final choices for glass kettles because of the preprogrammed temperatures for the different types of tea. I am very satisfied with making that choice.I noticed a couple of issues at first and then came to see they were at my end. I first thought the cord was a bit short but I then discovered that I had not fully pulled it out. Also, I usually put water to the min or 2 cup setting, as is my general practice. Its larger size requires a greater tilt, which would cause steam to flow across my hand during the pour. I realized that I was holding its handle near the top out of habit (from using the smaller kettle) and grasping the handle further below fixed that issue.I like the following features:- LEDs give a visual cue about when water is being heated. You can step away from the kettle and know from a distance when the water is ready, or despite other loud kitchen sounds.- You need a twist tie to manage extra length of the power cord on some appliances. This kettle lets you wrap extra cord underneath it for cleaner cord management.- The markings on the kettle make it easier to use just the amount of water you need.- I most often make green tea. Heating it only to the temperature needed for green tea lets me each get a better brew, and it takes less time for the water to be ready.One advantage my older kettle had on this one is that it had a higher wattage and, thus, offered faster heating. My use of the green tea makes this a moot point for me since my water seems to be ready more quickly than it did with the old kettle since I am heating to lower than a boiling temperature. I imagine I would notice the difference if I were going for full boiling temperature.I have had this product for 6 months with daily use. I got another as a gift for family.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 19, 2019
CommentsContent: This product stop working after one month I bought it.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 13, 2020
CommentsContent: This product is well designed and functions as expected. There are 3 types of settings - 6 buttons with different temperature settings (for various types of teas and coffee) + "start/stop" button + and a "keep warm" button.  The blue light adds a touch of beauty to its design. One feature I am still getting used to (a difference from my previous very simple electric cattle) - is before the water boils, it looks like the cattle is turning on and off multiple times. Once I understood that this a normal signal which indicates that boiling is about to be done, it all made sense. The water is fully boiled once the cattle beeps four times. Very happy with the purchase.The seller also promises an appreciation gift in exchange for a review - you can choose from 6 different options (about $15 value each). I am leaving a review, because I typically do when I am very happy or unhappy with a product, but this might be a nice incentive for some buyers - so I'm adding this piece of information in. It also tells me that this seller is committed to a quality customer care.

CommentsTitle: Just what I was looking for
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 2, 2021
CommentsContent: I started looking for an electric kettle so I could keep my water warm for a decent period of time.  I was using a kettle on the stove and had to reheat it when ever I wanted a new cup of tea.  This was one of the only kettles I found that has a 4 hour keep warm feature and I am very happy with it.  I put on the kettle in the AM and then again in the afternoon if I need it.  I usually heat some water in the evening for bedtime.  The water is always ready and I can change the temperature each time I use it.  Green tea in the AM and then warm water in the afternoon and in the evening I use the water to fill a hot water bottle for my feet in bed.  Super pleased with how this kettle functions.  It was worth the extra money to have the water stay warm for 4 hours a time.  My sister had a hot pot that I think must have been insulated because there was always hot water on her countertop until it ran dry and shut off.  I tried to find something like that from the 90's and all they had were huge ones for meetings or offices.  This is definitely a great choice for a personal size kettle.  It keeps me drinking more water during the day if it is warm.  I was running the sink until the water got warm and that wasted a lot of water.  As far as cleaning.  I just add some vinegar to the bottom before going to bed once a week and the next morning I rinse it out and start new water for the day.  I hope you enjoy yours as much as I do mine.

CommentsTitle: After two uses.......UPDATE TO ORIGINAL REVIEW 1/7/21
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 28, 2020
CommentsContent: 1/7/21- So I must say that the seller did reach out to me several times and sent replacements!  The first replacement was worse then the first kettle and the Seller Stephen sent a newer model within a few days.  The newer is much better than old on in design and in the quality of the stainless steel!  It still pitted but no where near as much as the first two.  I like it better I still don't love it.  But kudos to the seller and their galant efforts of customer satisfaction!So disappointed after reading all the reviews..lime deposits turned up after two uses of filtered water.  This really makes me feel like it is an unsafe product.  The company sent all this promo info and I reached to them and received no reply.  I am highly disappointed and returning.  UPDATE: its been one week since I reached out to the company for support and still no answer.  Do not buy this product.

CommentsTitle: Immpressive heating power with GREAT features
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 13, 2020
CommentsContent: I loved this electric kettle out of the box (which was very well packaged).  The durable heating pad had a great manually retractable cord which allows the user to eliminate a dangerous cord hanging out to be tripped over or snagged causing the kettle to spill.  The operating instructions were simple and straight forward leaving little doubt how to operate effectively and which is the best temperature to use for your drink of choice (lengthy menu  of drinks/temp. provided in the instructions.  The blue light ( i think there are other light color options available) is really cool as to know the kettle is functioning properly and that it may be HOT.  I really like the KEEP WARM feature that doesn't require the user to continually turn on/off the unit for desired results.  I also thought the filtration screen on the pour spout was a nice touch and can be seen in the boiling pot picture I have included with this review.  I would definitely recommend!!!

CommentsTitle: Love HadinEEon Variable Temp Electric Kettle
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States June 2, 2020
CommentsContent: This is our second HadinEEon electric kettle.  We were familiar with the high quality and really nice design and appearance of their product and thought the new version with its variable temperature feature and ability to hold temperature looked a nice add.  And it is.As with our first HadinEEon kettle, the family liked it immediately and the new features have been put to good use.  Our children‚Äôs families liked the first kettle and the response to this new one is even better with its new features.  We had no appreciation of how nice, and convenient, it is to keep water hot for use during certain times of the day.These kettles just make everyone smile as they use it. We are now a two-kettle family as making water hot has become a family ‚Äòdestination.‚Äô  I am sure more kettles are in our future as gifts to the kids.This is really just a great product.

CommentsTitle: Works well and looks good with some tradeoffs
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 26, 2020
CommentsContent: The kettle certainly looks great and works very well. However, there are some design compromises that you need to be aware of. First off, it trades speed for temperature accuracy. To get accurate temperature, it uses a lower output heat element and cycles the krttle on and off when it gets close to the desired temperature, a process that takes about 2 minutes to complete. Second, it trades design and style for usability with buttons to select the temperature you want directly but no display of what the current or selected temperature is. Lastly, it has a really good keep warm feature but pretty whimpy buzzer to let you know the water is heated.All in all a great kettle for the price, especially if you care strongly about heating water to exactly 200 F or any of the other presets the kettle supports.

CommentsTitle: This kettle hits all the spots!
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 15, 2020
CommentsContent: First, it's a 2L high capacity kettle, more than an average 1.7L kettles being sold on amazon.  Second, it is glass and metal construction, which is a lot safer than plastic kettles, as they don't release chemicals into the water.  Slide lock mechanism on the lid, which ensures that it's locked when pouring.  The glass let's you easily see how much water is in the kettle, and the LED light shows you that the kettle is heating the water, even if you are checking from across the room.  The sound indicates the water has reached a desired temperature, and the LED light turns off.  The buttons are logically laid out, and are clearly labeled; great for making tea!  The construction is top notch, so it should last a while!  Overall, extremely satisfied!  Relatives have been asking where I got it, so I'll be ordering a few more!

CommentsTitle: So much better than our Keurig
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 20, 2020
CommentsContent: We used a Keurig for years. It seems like it is convenient because you just plop a pod in the coffeemaker and push a button. But it is actually not. Getting the pods is a pain and they are very expensive. Plus, you are drinking coffee that has gone directly through plastic. That cannot be healthy. Besides, the water sits in that machine for a long time and you cannot clean it. Yuck. We ditched it in favor of this electric kettle and a french press. The whole set up cost a lot less than a Keurig and is way more healthy. Plus the coffee actually tastes good because you can use whatever you like. The kettle has been easy to clean and as long as we open the lid once it is empty, it dries and we haven't had any issues with rust. If you are on the fence, just buy this. You'll be glad you did.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 5, 2020
CommentsContent: Basically what the headline says - I only really have a hotplate in my kitchen, and up until now mornings before work consisted of putting my little old metal kettle on the hotplate and just checking the temperature periodically while grinding my coffee. Usually it'd take almost half an hour to get my morning coffee, despite my using the Aeropress, and a LOT of that was due to the hotplate and the kettle.And with this electric kettle, which not only got water to the temperature I needed much faster and lot more reliably without me having to check constantly, also freed up the hotplate. In the time it used to take to make one cup of coffee I am now capable of making three cups of coffee while cooking breakfast. This kettle is fast, consistent, and reliable, and I love it.

CommentsTitle: Great kettle if you are a die hard hot water fan!
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 30, 2020
CommentsContent: I drink hot water all day!  usually with green or herbal tea.  I was finding my tea tasted burnt while using an old electric kettle that just indiscriminately boiled water, even after washing and descaling that old kettle.  I saw this and thought how perfect!  It has a guide for temperatures appropriate for different teas versus coffee and that keep warm setting is extraordinaire!  The one glitchy thing is it seems to flip on and off  as the water gets "close to the set temperature"  it really put me off... but that is explained in the directions ---still weird tho... is my water done?  or not???  I got this on a great sale... but the price went up BIGTIME!  when I went to buy one as a gift :(  So right now, I think its a bit pricy as I paid over $15 less than the list price just last week!

CommentsTitle: Temperature settings are not accurate but company is responsive
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States April 29, 2020
CommentsContent: **update**A representative reached out to regarding my concerns. They really wanted to make the situation right which I really appreciated.I tested the temperature of this kettle with two different thermometers and at the 212 degree setting it did not even reach 200 degrees. I followed the instructions on the manual to be sure I was waiting the appropriate amount of time.Since I am using this kettle to brew tea, temperature accuracy is pretty important, I am disappointed in this purchase.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 5, 2021
CommentsContent: Follow the cleaning instructions to get the best possible use out of the machine itself. Scaling aka build-up will increase over time especially due to the hardness of your water but if you clean it say every couple of weeks you will limit the buildup for better tasting water. The bottom of the kettle does have a circular scale to it that seems to have been eaten away at the metal but then again properly cleaning will prevent deposits from entering your water and ultimately entering your body. Would buy again.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 14, 2020
CommentsContent: This is an excellent kettle, overall. The water heats fast, the temperature is on target, the pre-sets are perfect, and the keep-warm feature is a godsend to someone like me who wants multiple steeps over the course of a few hours. The one caveat I have is: DO NOT LEAVE IT FILLED WHILE STANDING COLD. Empty it when you're done. The seal around the heating element is not completely tight, when it's cold. And, okay, I'd rather have a long-lasting kettle that allows for expansion and contraction, yes, and the leak is not a fast one, but that was still annoying.EDITED TO ADD: Vendor contacted me, collected info about leak to pass back to R&D types, and offered a partial refund on my replacement kettle to make things good. Excellent customer service, and the new kettle has had no leaks at all!

CommentsTitle: Good for a daily use. Nice, neat and easy to use
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 4, 2019
CommentsContent: I liked this Kettle among many other options I can buy from Amazon. The price, the fact that it takes 2.0 liters NOT 1.7 and also the neatness of the whole thing.  I will watch it closely as we heavily using it for an office not in a house. I wonder if anyone has been using it for longer period of time. Other than that it is an excellent kettle.We have been using it now heavily and I really don't see anything wrong with it. You choose from several options of temperature. Also, I liked the beep when it finishes heating. This is in addition to the LED blue light that will blink and goes off when heating is finished. The wattage is the right one for a fast and stable heating process. Also the opening and closing of the glass kettle is well done that won't allow an exposure to heat or anything like that.  I surely recommend it for your tea, coffee and other hot drinks ‚òïüçº

CommentsTitle: Exceeds expectations, just watch your altitude
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 17, 2020
CommentsContent: It works very well and quickly. The keep warm feature is nice and I like that it has preset temperature controls for various types of teas. We have very hard water here, but it's remained clean and scale free. It is important to empty it when done and leave the lid open. This helps reduce buildup.Water tastes clean with no plastic-taste, a new change from the old plastic kettle I had before.The only issue I've had is due to the altitude I'm at, not the device. At nearly 4000 ft, setting the device to 212 degrees results in it continuing to boil the water without shutting off. This is because water can't hit 212 degrees at this altitude. But setting it at 200 works just fine. The other safety features are a nice touch, specifically for this situation.

CommentsTitle: Heats quickly, keeps it warm - has scaling ring. Update - stellar customer service.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 16, 2020
CommentsContent: 2/17/2020 Update - My original review below, did not include a Customer Service field when the site populated the  review fields.  After turning in that review, I was contacted today (the day after) and the store'c Customer Service department reached out and asked how they could make me happier, they were not happy because I was not 100% happy. So let me say this.  There is nothing they can do about the ring in the pot. But the way they reached out and wanted to address my concern, and let me know that the product has a three year warranty, and a one year money back guarantee - I found to be impressive. So for, the Customer Service and focus on Customer Satisfaction, I want it to be made clear that the store is top-rate. Overall rating is a 5 star experience.2/16/2020 OK, so I received a request to review this product after I received the one I ordered, which is not a regular thing. I figured why not, I have things to say about this electric teapot.So here are the LIKES: 1st  Like- love the glass; it allows me to see if the water level is low, and I can see how clean I am getting the pot. (Rated 3 stars for Easy to clean - because it is easy to clean less the heat ring issue - further explained below)2nd Like- the LED light makes it fun to watch.3rd Like- this pot heats your water fast, wastes no time.4th Like - the buttons have the temp and the type of beverage it is suitable for - i.e., 212 says "Black", 200 says French Press - the paperwork that comes with it tells you this and more.5th Like - It takes up very little counter space.6th Like - The glass is somewhat thicker than my coffee carafe for my coffee maker.7th Like - it is well balanced even at its fullest. I do not feel like I cannot hold or control the pour of the kettle.Now the "could improve" items:1st be weary issue - Not that I expected anything different, because glass is a good heat conductor, but the pot gets hot. So the drawback for the lights is, if you have little ones who can move chairs and climb to the counter level, be sure they know they "DO NOT TOUCH THE POT WITH THE FUN BUBBLES AND THE PRETTY LIGHT".2nd could improve issue - my home has a whole-house filter, and I have a filter in my fridge, and a filter under my kitchen sink. Thus the water I use is double filtered, however - the pot has still developed a scale or heat ring inside on the bottom that is NOT easily removed.  I actually need to use 1200 grit wet sand paper to remove it. I have never heated water int he pot with less than 4 cups of water. I am not sure if I used store bought water if this would have occurred anyway. Would be great to try it and see - maybe someone will post here about that.Even though it has a couple of flaws, as I listed, I still recommend the pot - because I do really enjoy it!Final note: The measurements are actual baking measurements - it is not like a coffee pot where the cups are based on 6 ounces (or 3/4 cup baking measurement). So 4 cups is truly 1 litre.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 27, 2020
CommentsContent: My boss got me thinking about an electric kettle after she brought one into the office.  After doing a little research, I chose this one because of the variety of heat settings and the "keep warm" feature along with high ratings.  I felt the price point was fair for a good quality item, and I have not been disappointed.While you certainly can brew an entire pot of tea right in the kettle, I use it for hot water exclusively, and then make individual cups of tea, as well as hot water to make broth from boulliion for recipes, and now for making my instant Keto coffee in the morning.  I have also used it to add enough hot water to cold potatoes to loosen them up enough for mashing, adding milk & butter afterwards.  Worked great!I found the instructions to be just a little lacking.  For example, I wondered if it would shatter the glass to add more cold, filtered water from my refrigerator to a pot of hot water.  I'm guessing it could so I have not tested this, but the directions offer no warnings like this.I am happy with my purchase and feel it is worth giving up a few inches of counter space. I use it almost every day.

CommentsTitle: Throw away your thermometer and timer.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 3, 2019
CommentsContent: We used to use a thermometer and timer to verify the correct temperature before adding tea leaves.  This new tea kettle allows one to set the temperature for steeping each type of tea.  The kettle reaches the preferred temperature quickly and  beeps when that temperature is reached.  If I had a quibble it would be that the button to open the kettle top in order to add warer isn't spring loaded one needs to lift the top after using the button release which is awkward if the kettle is still quite warm.  Otherwise, well designed

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 9, 2020
CommentsContent: Rusted inside after only 3 weeks of daily use.  Wow.  Glad it was glass so I could see the rust!!!!!!  No option for a replacement through Amazon.  Went with a different brand.

CommentsTitle: Went Haywire- but was replaced quickly
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States May 12, 2020
CommentsContent: This kettle was working great for about a month and then all of a sudden it wouldn't shut off after reaching a boiling point. I had to unplug it to turn it off and now it seems to be malfunctioning. The whole kettle got super hot, including the handle. Definitely seems like a fire hazard if you're not paying attention. Unfortunately, I can't find any answers in the manual that came with it. Super disappointed.UPDATEThe company sent a replacement within a day or two of me contacting them. Great customer service.

CommentsTitle: Perfect glass kettle with temperature control
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 10, 2020
CommentsContent: I ordered this kettle for our office. I love that this is a 2.0L capacity!  It‚Äôs a pretty glass with blue led lights and fun to actually see the water boiling. The temperature settings are a must as we drink a variety of teas. The keep warm for four hours feature is awesome so that water can be ready pretty much instantly when you need it. It was half the price of our other kettle we use in home. Plus it comes with a one year money back guarantee and a 3 year warranty!  They also send you detergent for cleaning the pot.  We will definitely need it because our water is hard and we get scaly miners deposits in our kettles. The only thing I would improve is the beeping noise when your water is done is not very loud. But that, in my opinion is a very minor thing and overall I‚Äôm very pleased!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 13, 2021
CommentsContent: We've been using this electric tea kettle since October 2020 and we love it! This purchase was a replacement of a different electric kettle model that died. We drink a lot of hot and cold tea, cocoa, and coffee (we use a pour over). I spent the extra money on the variable temperature feature and I'm happy I did. It is very convenient for the different types of tea we drink. I love that it has the boil feature because I love my coffee hot, and the lower temp feature allows me to make cocoa and not burn my mouth. I like that it beeps when it comes to temperature, I like that the vessel is bigger than our old one, and the blue lights are a nice touch - it makes me feel fancy. I have had no issues with any kind of leaking or rust or calcium buildup or anything for that matter. We use filtered water and we also empty it, clean it, and let it dry out each night as is suggested in the care instructions.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States June 6, 2020
CommentsContent: We got this after spending Christmas at a vacation rental with an electric kettle. To think I'd been living my life like a peasant heating my water up on the stovetop for so long when such options were available! We picked this one because it was still affordable but had more fancy buttons. I honestly have no clue what these buttons are for. I mean, I use black for my black tea and green for my green. But what is delicate? Are there delicate teas? Of is this so I can handwash my delicates in the kitchen sink. Probably not that since those usually say "handwash cold" so I use it for chamomile... I have no idea if chamomile is delicate or not though and I can't tell the difference anyways. It boils the water fast. It is pretty, affordable, and it has buttons!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 1, 2020
CommentsContent: WOW is pretty much all I can say!! I've been using this bad boy every day, sometimes multiple times a day, for the last couple of months, and it earns its keep more and more. Boiling is super fast, I love the snazzy blue light, cleaning is literally zero effort, and the safety is top notch! We have pretty hard water in our area, even when it's filtered (we only put filtered water in this kettle), but cleaning is a cinch. I put half water and half white vinegar in the kettle, let it sit for an hour, then boil it. The bottom will be sparkling clean! You'll want to run 2 or 3 more kettles full of plain filtered water to get rid of the vinegar smell/taste. This lil guy is a MUST for the fall and winter weather, I know we'll continue using it all the time! Highly recommend, totally worth the $$

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 7, 2019
CommentsContent: Even upon unboxing, you can sense that this kettle is well-made. The contact points between materials/components are solid and the glass feels sturdy. The LED lighting is a nice touch, and the fact that the kettle provides both audible and visual feedback on the completion of heating cycle is an added bonus, especially if you aren‚Äôt paying full attention, or are hard of hearing. The selection and activation buttons are not only lit when you press them, but they are tactile with a click response, so you know and feel when you‚Äôve pressed the selection successfully. The buttons themselves are rubbery and firm, which instills confidence in me that I am not going to pop one out or loosen the connections with constant use. The base fits well, and the grounded, well-shielded cord is also a confidence boost for use in the kitchen. The lid is solid and locks in place well. Mine was a little stuck when closing, but a little pull of the release mechanism and it closes/locks snuggly. I have confidence that with normal, proper use, you shouldn‚Äôt have to worry about the lid popping open.The finish on the steel of the kettle looks great aesthetically with my other appliances.I do not really have a use for a ‚ÄúKeep Warm‚Äù feature, so I cannot attest to it.I have a water dispenser in my fridge, but for adding water to the kettle with another cup the position of the the lid makes it a little awkward for pouring. Not a deal-breaker.For the price-point I absolutely recommend it. I don‚Äôt have experience with kettles at higher prices, but in my opinion of a glass, temperature-adjustable, cordless electric kettle, you won‚Äôt need to spend up to double (in some cases) for competing models.

CommentsTitle: Shaky start but working like a dream now
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 4, 2020
CommentsContent: The first time I plugged it in, I was afraid it was defective. All of the lights on the unit's buttons kept flashing on and off and pressing one of them did nothing. I unplugged the unit, emptied the water, and let it sit for a while. I thought I was going to have to send it back, but decided to try it again because I really didn't want to deal with the return process during covoid. The second time the lights did not flash and I was able to choose a temperature. It heated perfectly and quickly. It seems to be working fine now. (I guess my prayers to the Amazon gods worked.) The unit looks classy and heats water like a dream. My only suggestion is that the beeps to tell me it's reached temperature could be a little louder because they are barely audible, but that is not extremely important because the lights go off too. I'm very pleased with the performance so far.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 21, 2020
CommentsContent: We use this everyday.  It heats a lot of water very quickly.  And ours has the keep warm function for 12 hours, not just the four listed in the description.  The description says it is fast and quiet.  I don't know about that quiet part - it does say "quieter than others on the market..."  maybe it is.  Hey, it's boiling up some water, it's going to make some noise.  It doesn't bother me - actually I'm quite content with it as the noise let's me know it's doing its job to heat up my water!  The multi-temp option is so much nicer than what was offered on a more basic model at Costco.  We're so happy with this purchase.Note; we use hard water so there's an accumulation of mineral deposits starting to form - which is rather unsightly.  So maybe you'll want to filter or purify your water to keep your kettle looking good as new.  Obviously, that is no fault of the product - just trying to be helpful.

CommentsTitle: Everything I'm looking for in a kettle.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 12, 2021
CommentsContent: Huge capacity, quick heating, spot-on temp settings.  The only thing I wish it had was the ability to set a time to turn the kettle on, but to be honest, I'm surprised this has all the features it has at this price point, I'm just being feature greedy now :) I miss the gooseneck of my old kettle, but the spout on this allows for a nice, controlled pour none the less, especially given the size of the kettle.I'll admit I had a problem with my first kettle, but the seller handled the issue with aplomb.  If you have any problems, just contact the seller. After talking to their customer service, I'm certain they'll take care of any problems you may have, they were super quick in helping me out.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 16, 2020
CommentsContent: I had a Cuisinart electric kettle that died after about 2/3 years. I was wanting to replace it, but really wasn't loving the $100+ price tag. I finally decided to give this one a go, and it's been great! I really like the blue light indication that it's heating up or done (though I do miss the beeping of my Cuisinart). It heats up well and seems pretty reliable. Only minor nitpick is that the opening is a bit sticky (doesn't open up as smoothly as I would like), but that doesn't interfere with how it works. I'm glad I chose this electric kettle.If I'm comparing it to my Cuisinart, I would give it a 4 star (based on compared aesthetics), but just judging it for how it's performed and how it's held up after about 10 uses, I'm giving it a 5.It will at first have sort of an odd smell. At first I was concerned that the metal / plastic / something was burning, but that went away after a couple of uses. Worth the purchase!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 11, 2020
CommentsContent: We love our new HadiEEon Variable Temperature electric kettle.  It heats up quickly and gives an alert when the water has boiled, and the safety feature is a must for me, so that it turns itself off when ready so I don‚Äôt need to hover over it.  You canPick the temp of the water to suit your needs, and the beautiful blue light is so pretty.I love that it will keep your water hot so you can have hot water when needed, as I constantly need to top off my coffee.  I also love that you can see any lime build up and it easily removes with waters and vinegar, I think the taste of the water is way better than my old kettle.We loved it so much, we bought my Mother and father in-law one for Christmas.  Would definitely recommend.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 26, 2020
CommentsContent: I liked the fact that it heats water. I didn't like the fact that they ask you to write a review for a free gift, and the free gift that I wanted was "unavailable." Can you imagine? A company soliciting feedback for their product, claiming that you can get a free coffee grinder...and then your only options include nightlights, LED string, see-through expresso mugs (oops...those were also unavailable!), an aromatherapy diffuser (that's the one my husband wants me to get), a glass teapot, etc.. Sigh. What's a lady to do? (Husband yelling "Diffuser! Diffuser!"). My real concern is what are they going to do with my name, address, and email. Are they going to sell my information? Am I going to get mysterious packages in the mail from China? Where is this all leading? Oh, well. To soothe my loving husband's heart, we will probably copy and paste this review, and send it along with a request for the diffuser. But if they ask me to submit another review for the diffuser, I'm just going to give up.

CommentsTitle: Great quality with only a couple of usage quirks
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 22, 2020
CommentsContent: The kettle is compact enough, considering the two liter capacity. The glass and metal elements appear to be of good quality, and no plastic touches the water. The base is cleverly designed so the cord coils snugly underneath it with no clutter. Buttons are backlit, and don't have any labels that look like they could ever fade.Its 1200W heating element took just under 5 minutes to boil 1L of water to 212, and about 9 minutes to boil 2L.I got this for tea. It heated 1L of room temperature tap water to 175 F in 2:56 by my stopwatch and got 178 degrees F as measured with a meat thermometer. It will lose about 8 degrees when poured into the cup so this is quite precise!That's nearly a minute slower than my previous Adagio kettle for my typical use case of heating less than a liter to 175, because it turns the heating element on and off a few times as it reaches the target temperature, trading speed for precision.When the heating element is on, LEDs beneath the glass light up bright blue. It can be a bit confusing that it turns the LEDs on and off a couple times while it's closing in on the temperature. It emits 3 soft but audible and pleasant beeps when it hits the target temperature. That's the best feature because you can walk away and hear it, and you should because 3 minutes feels longer than it sounds.The kettle both beeps and lights up when put on the base, which seems a bit unnecessary to me but there must be some kind of sensory impairment that is helped by that.It "forgets" its settings rather quickly if taken off the base for 20 seconds or so. What that means practically is that if you want to heat it to anything but boiling and keep it warm, that's 3 button presses each time: temperature, keep warm, and start. Would be nice if it could remember my last temperature and keep-warm settings, but that's not a common feature at this price point.If set to keep warm, it does so by briefly turning on the heating element occasionally to keep near the set temperature. I don't recommend that to keep the water boiling, but it's good for tea temperatures and can be a handy feature if you re-use tea leaves.The latch on top can be an annoyance: you can press it to open the kettle to fill, but you also need to press it when closing the kettle or else the little removable filter in the lid gets caught on the lip of the glass.Overall this is a great kettle, but some usability issues around how many button-presses it takes to use it, the top latch, and the lower-power heating element makes it not quite right for me.Edit: after trying other kettles and considering, I believe 5 stars is the only fair rating for this kettle. It does what it's supposed to, looks and functions great, and the service is top-notch. They include a warranty and returns on Amazon are easy so there's no reason not to try it. Disclosure: the company DID offer a small gift for writing a review, but they had NO input or comment into the content or rating of my review, honest.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 6, 2020
CommentsContent: I waited to review till I tested this out.  For the money I am very pleased.  There are not many electric kettles that have temperature control and tell what its for.  Many just have temp but not labeled what tea/ coffee type it‚Äôs for, I find this very helpful. I would like it to brew faster, but the time seems to be standard compared to others. The heat output seems to run a few degrees under, but produces good green, herbal, and black teas as well as coffee. Warming feature is a combination of three buttons but no brainer once you read manual. For the safety feature it turns itself off if the kettle is s empty so definitely happy with that.  For the price I think it has all the features of more expensive brands.

CommentsTitle: Perfect kettle for brewing different teas
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 7, 2020
CommentsContent: I love tea, and have a huge collection of different types--from herbals to greens to blacks and everything in between. If you know tea, you know that the water temperature at which you brew the tea makes a big difference in the flavor profile of the tea, and this kettle is perfect for that. It's pretty quick to heat up to any temperature, and I love that it's clear glass. It looks so sleek and nice on my countertop! The auto shut-off is great for safety, but I also like that I can choose to keep the water at a certain temperature so that I can have a second cup later in the morning. Would highly recommend this kettle for a sharp-looking, mid-range, temperature-controlled tea kettle!

CommentsTitle: Great Gift, Heats Fast, We Use it Every Day
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 6, 2020
CommentsContent: I purchased this for my wife who is an avid home brew ice team maker. It is safe to say we use this kettle everyday. The heat settings allow us to adjust temp for not scalding green tea leaves. I also use the kettle for instant oatmeal. I personally like the alarm that lets me know when water is at temp but not so loudly that the kettle wakes up the entire house when I get up early. The large size is just right for a full pitcher of ice, but not so large that it takes up too much counter space. The kettle heats fast so you are not left standing there waiting. The one miss, I with this was integrated with Alexa so I could schedule heating in the AM when my phone detects when I get up, know and alert me when it reaches temp if I leave the room, and not heat up when there is no water. That would be AWESOME!!!

CommentsTitle: Keep warm and settings for green tea...high capacity -- it's all good
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 20, 2019
CommentsContent: What's good about it?  High capacity.  Keep warm feature.  Clear glass - not tinted or mirrored so cleaning when needed will probably be easier.  I've switched to green and matcha tea -- the lower temperature controls are helpful for a perfect brew.Our previous electric kettle inconveniently died after only 18 months -- six months after the manufacturer's warranty ended.  This kettle has a 36-month warranty, so we are happy with the confidence that HadinEEon has in its product longevity.  Time will tell of course.  Read the instructions on temperature settings less than 212 degrees -- it's a two-step process: Select Temp then Start.  But if you just want to boil water, press Start and you're good to go.What's bad about it?  There is nothing bad about this kettle I have noticed.  However, as a side note, I'd point out that with any electric kettle, it takes longer to heat more water rather than less.  Since this kettle has a higher capacity of 2.0 liters(!) so fill only with the water level you really need; This minimizes the waiting time and saves electricity.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 19, 2021
CommentsContent: I didn't want to spend close to $60 for this kettle but once it got here and even more so after using it for a few months, I'm glad I did. I had to send back a cheaper version I tried before because it was impractical. This one is great. When making green tea I set the temp to 160 rather than waiting for the water to cool after the previous kettle turned off. It boils water more quickly than the stovetop. Oh and it has a keep warm function. Shouldn't be a surprise at that price but I had no idea how much I would love that function. The cord is flexible and long enough whereas the previous kettle had a short, extremely thick, unbendable cord. After about 6 weeks of daily, continuous use there was some mineral settlement on the bottom and sides. I boiled about 1/3 full of white vinegar and let it sit for 24 hours then boiled several times a full pot of water to get rid of the taste and it was just as new. Highly recommended.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 6, 2021
CommentsContent: This is a great tea kettle. I wish the temperature options were not quite so "spread out" - but it works well enough. The calibration is not dead on - but again, it's within a few degrees. That being said, I live at 7,000 feet elevation - so water boils at a lower temperature then sea level. The thermostat and temp setting may work better at sea level for this and any similar kettle. When I first received it, I inadvertently threw away the instructions before I'd had a chance to read them and was not sure how the "keep warm" setting worked. I emailed the company after tracking down the product right away and got a very quick response the the manual digitally sent to me. Overall, I would recommend this product and the company who manufactures it.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 13, 2020
CommentsContent: We‚Äôve only had it a short while but so far it is working well.  It has buttons with pre-determined temperatures, and a guide of different temperatures for different teas in the manual.  We are getting more into teas and are realizing we have probably been using the wrong T for many of them with a basic kettle.  You can‚Äôt set your own T, you have to use one of the pre-programmed ones.  You select the T you want and then press start.  A blue light goes on when the water is heating up, a beep tells you when it‚Äôs done.  You can hold the water at temperature when it‚Äôs done but we haven‚Äôt tried that feature yet.  It doesn‚Äôt take up a lot of room on the counter.  Overall we are happy with it.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 3, 2020
CommentsContent: We have gone through 4 other teapots before this one. An older workhorse than just boiled water and held up for 4  years. And then we went through 3 different teapots that all had lots of bells and whistles. Infusers, temperature controls in 5-10 degree increments, warmers, etc. Those all broke. One teapot gave us a replacement and it broke again. They got dirty and we had to clean them all the time because of the tea being steeped in them, which we think contributed to their rapid decline. They were also not very expensive, around $40-$50 for all of those features. We came to the conclusion that you get what you pay for, and all those features might be too much in a single teapot. Infusing tea in the kettle itself might be too hard on the sensor or the components. So we went with this teapot. It had lots of reviews, the core features we needed, it was big enough for what we do. It had all the temperature controls we wanted for the different types of teas we drink and other things that we need it for. And it has a warmer feature that we use occasionally. It really is a solid tea pot and has held up so far without any problems. We also haven't noticed any gross things  building up inside it so far like the last ones because all that happens is that we boil filtered water (or get water hot) every day.If it fails in the future, I'll come back and update this review.

CommentsTitle: Are you thinking what I was?
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 27, 2020
CommentsContent: Here‚Äôs what I was thinking:- great design and look- temperature control- price and reviews check out- how hard is it to make a kettle?1 week and the thing was dead. The lights still come on but the heating circuit is toast. Now amazon wants me to pack it back up and bring it to a shipping depot. How about we donate it instead to the garbage heap.Lesson learned, buy from a trusted brand.

CommentsTitle: Lots of better functions than a regular kettle, temperature not accurate
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 4, 2021
CommentsContent: Almost everything about this kettle is wonderful. The only downside is we tested the kettle out for temperature accuracy- it was consistently below the temperature it was set to. We put the hot water in a hot mug and it would be anywhere between 20-5 degrees lower than it was supposed to be. I did refill the hot kettle with cold water to test that out too. Everything else is great. It beeps when the water is done, does have varying temperature controls, has a fun blue light, and I would absolutely buy it again (although this is day 1 of using it).  The only thing I would want is an electronic temperature reader or custom set. But that seems picky.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 28, 2019
CommentsContent: I did a house-sit in England and used the host's kettle while I was there.  The kettle she had was over $100 and so I looked for a less expensive alternative.  My husband did extensive research and gave me a few to choose.  I chose this one because I liked the fact it was glass.  I was concerned, however, about the small pour spout, but I got it anyway.This was definitely the right choice.  It works great, is easy to clean, and I don't have a problem spilling like I thought I would.  We use this every day for various reasons.P.S.  The manufacturer offered me a gift for my review, but I was going to review them anyway.

CommentsTitle: The tea kettle of my dreams!
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States May 1, 2020
CommentsContent: I have been using variable temp electric tea kettles since my very first Cuisinart, probably 35 years ago. I drink different types of tea, and I use a French press for coffee, so a variable temp kettle is a basic kitchen requirement. My last one just gave up the ghost after 12 years, and I bought this one. WOW!!! I think every other kettle I have had is, at most, 1.7 liter. This one is a fat 2.0 liters, and I could not be happier. My borosilicate glass tea pot holds a bit over 1.7 liters, so I have always had to slightly over-fill my kettle to get a full teapot. Not anymore!  And like some kind of unexpected bonus, this unit is totally gorgeous, and "goes" with my blue-lighted kitchen :-). Bravo!!Update: Love it even more! ;-)

CommentsTitle: Almost DOA but company replaced it and replacement works well .
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 30, 2019
CommentsContent: Updated review : The company was contacted by amazon and they were prompt in replacing the kettle that died after four days. The replacement kettle works well. I have not been able to update the review due to illness. I am happy with the replacement .

CommentsTitle: The variable temperature settings and warming feature a PLUS!
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 12, 2019
CommentsContent: I gave this 5 stars because of the features it has. It's guiet, has multiple tea and french press hot water settings. What I really think stands out is it's warming features, I don't have to reheat the water, you can have it warmed for 12 hours. I also like the cup markings though depending on your cup size you may have to increase the water slightly. And it has an alarm so when it's ready if you're doing something else it's a great little reminder your water is ready. The one thing that could be improved, though minor is the top, there is a button for your finger on the top to open it and the top itself is small. This is very minor compared to all of the pluses so I didn't take a point off for it. The blue lights are a visual that just looks cool.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 14, 2019
CommentsContent: We've owned many electric kettles over the years and this is our all-time favorite. We've had kettles that kept the water warm (or attempted to) and others that had a temperature control. But this one has both those features and much more. The water remains hot for hours. It's easy to operate. Other kettles have a general temperature setting by degrees, not by use (black tea vs. green tea for example). Every day we use it for green tea and either French press or black tea. Having all these settings is wonderful. And it's lovely to look at--the blue light as it's heating is a very nice feature as well. Highly recommend this kettle!

CommentsTitle: Decent product but could have been much better
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 2, 2020
CommentsContent: The build quality was good and the heat output was also nothing to complain about. Water heated up quickly and switched off at the preset temperature.However, I had two issues - the temperature seemed to be off by about 10F (as checked with a calibrated contact thermometer). Also the volume markings on the glass are inaccurate by a large margin. The .5 liter marking was actually only 300ml.So its perfectly ok for general purpose heating but if you want precise control over volume and temperature then its not that great.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 31, 2019
CommentsContent: These reviews are bought. This company gives you free stuff in exchange for reviews. Problem is, these doesn't work that well. There automatic shut off doesn't work, it discolored on it's first use, it's not built to last very long

CommentsTitle: Good kettle but could be better at maintaining a boil
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 1, 2019
CommentsContent: The kettle is great and much as expected. However, one complaint we have is that the kettle will not maintain a boil after it senses it has reached a boil. If you want to fill your tea pot with boiling water, then you must be ready with the pot and bags as soon as the kettle reaches boil. Pushing the "boil" button will not keep the kettle actively heating for boil. This was disappointing as my previous kettle (different brand but same idea with the multiple temperatures) could do this. My husband now adds COLD water to the boiled water to trick the kettle into heating up again so that he can have a second attempt at being ready EXACTLY at the boil.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 20, 2021
CommentsContent: This is the first time I have purchased an electric kettle. My friend recommended this exact one and I am so glad I listened to her. It just arrived yesterday and I have already used it 3 times! It is so easy to use and I really love the temperature buttons on the handle. What really sold me on it was the keep warm option, not only will it keep your water warm for your 2nd cup of tea, but it will hold it at the original temp!! I love not having to use the microwave to heat my water anymore. It heats the water up so fast. The only thing I don't like about it is the lid does not come off but I have a bottle sponge that works to clean it. I would definitely recommend this product.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 12, 2020
CommentsContent: I've used this kettle for about a month. I bought it to heat water for my French Press coffee and wife's tea. It heats the water faster than microwave.  Like the variable temperature setting.  Does the job of boiling water very well.  Dislike the weight of kettle.  If I had a do over I would buy a smaller kettle.  I have arthritis in my hands.  The only other negative is the fact that that the keep warm function does not always work.  I have to manually reset the temperature again.  It's supposed to hold the setting for 20 seconds after removing from base.  Not a real deal breaker.  Overall I'm satisfied with purchase

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States May 4, 2019
CommentsContent: I just got my kettle yesterday so this is more of an initial review and I plan to follow up in a few months with another. So far I love the kettle with the different temperature settings and keep warm option. It is a little lighter than I was expecting, but this is not necessarily a bad thing. Overall, it is doing it's job and I think it is a great electric kettle.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 1, 2020
CommentsContent: Update: about four months in, daily use, and absolutely zero complaints. So beyond happy with this purchase!! Highly highly recommend!!I haven't had this more than a week so will update after more frequent use. But so far I'm loving it! I considered getting the cheaper version, but when I saw the different temperature settings on this one I had to choose it. We're soon ditching our drip coffee pot and switching to a french press, and I knew that boiling 212¬∞ wasn't the right temperature for coffee or most teas.It works pretty fast, and I love that I can just set it to the desired temp, turn it on, and walk away to wait for the beep. Overall highly satisfied so far!

CommentsTitle: Buttons and lid closure should be redesigned.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 30, 2020
CommentsContent: I replaced a Cuisinart variable temperature with this one after many years of problem free service, mainly choosing based on price point and the option of keeping the water at temperature for an extended time.  The temperature buttons in this one are small and not as easy to read. Opening the lid requires pulling on a sliding type opener on top of the lid putting your hand in the way of steam if you are refilling a hot kettle and the lid closes completely only if it‚Äôs pushed fairly hard. I find it to be a little slow heating.

CommentsTitle: A solid kettle that works well!
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 17, 2020
CommentsContent: The variable settings on this kettle are great, especially if you're a tea drinker into various kinds of teas (as well as coffee or just need hot water for something)!There is a feature that allows you to keep the water warm after you have heated it to the desired temperature, which has come in very handy as well.The blue lights are a fun way to know when your kettle is on/working - the only downside is getting this user to remember to press the "Start" button AFTER selecting which temperature I want!Also i love that i now have a kettle that is NOT heating up my water in plastic - the glass works well, and having the visual of being able to see how far along the water is helps too.

CommentsTitle: Great design, fast heating, stays hot for hours
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States June 26, 2020
CommentsContent: Product arrived quickly from seller, worked as advertised.  The see-through design is pretty cool to watch with a subtle blue light flash indicator to tell you when its ready, and you can see it start to bubble with the light also which looks cool.  The keep hot function for 4 hours is a great feature, because everyone knows you start a kettle and forget, then come back and find it finished heating but then cooled down.  Not with this model.. .will keep it hot for 4 hours.  Has plenty of capacity as well.  I even use it to speed up cooking pasta by heating half the needed water in this kettle and pouring it into my pot that was heating on the stove.  Pasta in half the time!

CommentsTitle: Makes a great pot of tea and excellent quality
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 8, 2019
CommentsContent: I purchased this product to make Ice Tea.  The product arrived promptly and was well packaged. Easy to follow instructions were included. Its very easy to use and I like that it has different settings on the handle to make different types of teas.(black, green, oolong, variable.) The water heats up very fast and has all the warming and/or shut off features you would expect in a quality product. The design of the pitcher is nice and has blue lights that come on when its heating the water. Once the water is heated I pour it into a glass pitcher (Pykal) made to handle boiling water to steep and store the tea. I used to haul out a heavy pot and store the tea in a Rubbermade pitcher. The tea is much brighter and tastes dramatically better then my old method. I haven't tried the white or oolong tea yet, but the black tea makes an excellent pot of tea. I wasn't expecting it to be this noticeable. The lid seems to be of good quality and the markings to note how low/high to fill the kettle are clear and easy to read. The cord is well designed and fits nicely under the power base. Other nice things include a heat resistant handle, the variable temperature control and the lid has a filter for water build up. It is also easy to clean. I highly recommend this kettle.

CommentsTitle: Safe, efficient with lots of extras!
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 28, 2020
CommentsContent: I just returned another brand‚Äôs kettle because it got warm overnight even when shut off. And I hated the fact that when you picked it up, it didn‚Äôt shut off. This one checks all of my boxes for safety and efficient water heating.  I especially appreciate the fact that it turns itself off when you pick it up. That‚Äôs a basic safety feature.  I love the fact that I can choose different temperatures (husband drinks green, I drink black tea) and the keep warm feature is nice. I also like that it chimes to let me know when it is ready. Those are extras I didn‚Äôt expect to care about but that are actually nice to have.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States June 15, 2020
CommentsContent: I‚Äôve been using this kettle almost daily (I love tea!) and it works great! It heats up the water to boiling in about 2 minutes. I love the various temperature settings and the fact it maintains that temperature for a few hours before the kettle shuts off automatically. The blue led light is a neat feature. I think for the price, you can't do any better than this! The glass is easy to keep clean; once a week I add vinegar and set to boil to remove the mineral buildup and just to keep it looking and smelling fresh. Oh, I use my filtered fridge water if anyone is wondering. I would highly recommend this electric kettle! I hope it continues to work for years to come.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 29, 2020
CommentsContent: I am careful to give a five-star review for any electric appliances that I bought. I waited until two months from the purchase date to test the quality of this kettle. Indeed, this electric kettle is exceptionally good function and it can boil the water less than 10 minutes to make my coffee and tea daily. This kettle material is made of high heat resistant Borosilicate Glass with blue light and has an automatic shut off safety feature. I love this electric kettle and I recommend this kettle to my friends and anyone who loves instant ready hot water in the morning, afternoon, and nighttime to prepare hot beverages.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 8, 2021
CommentsContent: I‚Äôve had this kettle for several months now and it is wonderful! I am an avid tea drinker, so I use it every day. With my old kettle, I used to have to let my boiled water sit a few minutes before pouring it so I didn‚Äôt scald my green and white teas, but this kettle removes all the guess work! I love being able to choose different water temperatures according to each type of tea. This kettle is quiet and quick. The ‚Äúkeep warm‚Äù is perfect for this busy mother of 3 who is often distracted. And the blue lighting is very pretty. I‚Äôve been very happy with this purchase and would absolutely recommend.

CommentsTitle: A great tea kettle for the discriminating tea drinker!
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 9, 2021
CommentsContent: I was looking for an alternative to a Breville (which I have at home) for my office, but one that also had specific temperature controls for various teas. I was just refilling and brewing a pot of hot water when the opportunity came to me to write this review. I have enjoyed using this tea kettle for brewing black and green teas (and an occasional oolong!) The heat control has been effective although I have not verified to the degree. It also has handy features regarding keeping the pot warm for those second and third cups!I picked it up on sale, but it is still a good value for the price. Recommended!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 18, 2021
CommentsContent: Overall, this kettle works well.  I like the "keep warm" feature that allows for the water to stay at the temperature you picked for a while so that if you or someone else wants another cup of tea or hot chocolate you don't have to wait for the water to heat up again.  I will say however that you really need to be aware and listen for the "beep" that lets you know when the water meets the temperature you selected because it is a very soft beep.  The one other feature that this kettle is lacking that I had on a different one I had was the ability to see the temperature digitally as it heated.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States June 27, 2019
CommentsContent: I started drinking tea more as of late, but from researching I found out that you can actually burn tea and that is what can make it taste bitter! I've always just used a kettle on the stove, until now. I began using this electric kettle the day it arrived. The settings are easy and the buttons are even labeled for the type of tea or coffee you are making. It saves me a lot of time in the morning because I don't have to wait for that annoying whistle (and wake everyone else up in the process). Now, I can just set the temperature, start it, and tell it to keep warm while I am getting ready. It is so easy to use and worth every penny! My partner loves it too because it has a french press setting. If you are a tea lover like me, you'll love this kettle.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 27, 2021
CommentsContent: We purchase this about 3+ months ago. It has performed very well for what we were looking for. I like the glass kettle, I can see what's inside, and the blue light feature also tells you that your water is boiling/ready.
