The only con here is that the glass gets hot, good for an adult household, you have to be careful if you have kids or pets around.The head out put works fine, however, you do need two hands to operate it, I have used electric kettles where you can do this with one hand only. It is not a nuisance, and maybe someone with bigger hands than mine can hold the pot handle and operate the lever with one hand.We also like the temperature feature, very convenient for making tea or geting the water to a french press temperature. The capacity is good enough, we usually fill it half way.

CommentsTitle: Quick heat, easy use, very beautiful
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 6, 2019
CommentsContent: It's a very good looking Electric Kettle and easy to use. Ideal for making tea, or just for hot water.It's just a little taller than the water faucet on my refrigerator, so every time I need to use another container to take water then add to the kettle.Another issue is that after 2-3 days use, I found there are 30%-40% of the bottom of the kettle showing small dark spots, and those spots cannot be easily cleaned by dish liquid detergent nor vinegar with hours soaking. Previously I thought it might be a quality issue, but the last time I tried to use vinegar to soaking overnight, and those dark spots are all gone~! Yeah, great, like new.Therefore, especially functional speaking, I like this kettle!

CommentsTitle: Beautiful kettle sets the mood and the temp
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States June 13, 2020
CommentsContent: My previous stainless steel electric kettle with temp control started leaking so I figured I would upgrade.I love this kettle. It's beautiful. The light is gorgeous and the clear glass is stunning. It really sets the mood for me to enjoy my tea. I have tea every day and I cycle through tea preferences weekly if not daily. I love the different temperature settings and keep warm function.Since this stays on the counter and it's used everyday, I'm glad I got a pretty one.One thing I noticed is that it has a three-prong plug. Nothing major--I just realized it was different from my previous.But really, I just love looking at it!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 8, 2020
CommentsContent: I already have this kettle and have used it for the last year or so and purchased another one to have as a backup because it was on sale for a great price and couldn't pass it up!  I drink loose leaf tea so water temperature is extremely important to me and the ease of use makes this the perfect kettle.  I've had several other electric temperature control kettles over the years but this is by far the best one I've ever used....have never had a problem with it and have zero complaints.  It's easy to clean and though I use mine everyday all day long it still looks brand new....you'll love it!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 4, 2020
CommentsContent: Disclaimer: I'm submitting a review upon receipt of this item as part of an incentivized product registration process. So, I'm limited to describing first impressions and one-time use. Still, so far, so good. The kettle is replacing a model at a lower price point that was stainless steel and without the variable temp option, which lasted us for a little less than four years. (It began having issues staying closed with the spring-loaded lid mechanism catch, and then with maintaining proper contact with the power supply, which it eventually stopped doing.) In comparison, this one is larger capacity (2.0 liters as opposed to 1.7), slightly less wattage (1200W vs. 1500W), and so far has shown itself to be quieter and still quick to heat/boil. I like the glass carafe, and the varied temp control is an added feature I look forward to utilizing as someone who enjoys tea culture when I have time. (Usually I don't, but I have some aging Pu-erh cakes around and I'm now a little more tempted to get some green or white teas, for example, knowing that I can do a better job of brewing and enjoying them before they sit too long in my cabinets.)In comparison to my old one, I'd say this kettle is quite "substantial." I think this is positive insofar as it feels like it is metal and glass and not so much plastic. On the other hand, one other reviewer commented on it being heavy which could potentially create some difficulties if you're arthritic, for example. (I don't know if others like this on the market are any different or not.) I haven't yet tried to explore settings and features... hopeful that it's possible to turn off and on things like the "keep warm" function, which is generally welcome. I, too, like the blue light. :-)All in all it looks solid and I'm hopeful I will get several good years from it. Naturally, time will tell. The 3-year warranty would seem like decent insurance should issues arise. Best of luck in your search!

CommentsTitle: Pretty Glass Kettle: LED lights, multiple settings, sleek modern design
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 18, 2019
CommentsContent: I love this Electric Kettle! It so pretty and has blue LED lights that come on when it's heating water to 6 different temperature settings.  It has cup/liter measurements, 2 4 6 8 cups, on the side so you can heat and pour when adding to a recipe.  It beeps 3 times when your water temperature has been reached and automatically shuts off.  The clear glass design also looks less cluttered when sitting on the counter. I also really like that there isn't an excessive amount of steam coming from the top when the water comes to a boil. I've used a Chef's Choice stainless electric kettle for years and it produced so much steam that I had to move it out to the edge of the counter to prevent excessive steam on cabinet above my kettle. This kettle: boils, beeps and shuts off!

CommentsTitle: Convenient product that can be better with a few adjustments
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 15, 2020
CommentsContent: Its a good product as long as you can put up with innitial four five water boiling with a very strong plastic taste in water...I was at the verge of returning it when I realized the smell was disappearing gradually. Also, it would be more convenient if lid opening could be adjusted at top of handle instead of top of lid. The base material could do with a bit of upgrading, as it feels to be inconsistent with rich looking fascade of the product.Otherwise its a convenient product with quick boiling features for varying temperatures.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States June 19, 2020
CommentsContent: This kettle has worked spectacularly for us! I love the multiple temperature options the accommodate the various teas in our cabinets. I also use it to keep water at a boil when I'm doing a massive meal prep - it opens up a burner on the stove that doesn't need to be dedicated to boiling water, and water's always ready at boil whenever I need to use it for a recipe.The only issue we've encountered so far is the "floating shiny specks" in the water that others have commented on, as well. It turned out that we just needed to boil 1 cup of vinegar with 1 cup of water in the kettle whenever this happens - floating specks and calcification on the bottom metal portion of the kettle disappear! We've had to deal with this twice in the 6 months we've had the kettle so expect to clean it every 3 months or so.

CommentsTitle: LOVE my new HadinEEon tea kettle!!
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 6, 2020
CommentsContent: I might have waited too long to get an actual temperature controlled tea kettle because I can't get over this thing. Before, I was putting a thermometer in my kettle and having to keep track of the temp. It would go too high and then too low. Enter stage right, my new tea kettle! My pic is to show size compared to other items. This was important to me because I didn't want it to be too big. I like that it's clear, the blue light is fun and actually helpful. I like that it will maintain a temp until I can get to it. I'm in heaven. Over an electric tea kettle. Obvi I don't get out much these days.

CommentsTitle: I've been meaning to buy a kettle for a long time
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 7, 2020
CommentsContent: My husband picked this out based on amazon reviews.  I liked the fact that you could see the water through the clear glass.  This is really a very sleek design.  The round base sits on the counter and the kettle fits into that.  2 pieces total.It also has temperature controls on the top.  Not that I drink such precise temperature teas, but I know which temperature I can drink almost right away and which I have to put 2 ice cups in so as not to burn my tongue.I finally decided to get this after our kitchen remodel so it sits on our countertop all the time and is ready for use.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 10, 2019
CommentsContent: First of all I'd like to draw the line between "electric kettle" and "temperature control electric kettle", especially if you are big fan of tea. Presets for White, Green, Oolong and Black make every tea session as simple as it could be."Keep warm" feature is also handy to keep selected temperature for 12 hrs.Speaking of the product itself and build quality - it's slick, convenient and has a magnificent blue illumination while it heats. Due to initial light weight it's also on safer side when operated by people who does not have strong hands to hold 2 liters of boiling water with one hand - at least my 10 yo kid managed to do it safe.The cup is made of borosilicate glass, which is known for its very low thermal expansion coefficients. It also does pretty good job to protect you from burns when you would accidentally touch the kettle full of boiling water.As for things that "could be better" - when on full 2 liter volume, it actually takes time to boil it up. This is a kind of  expected for 1200W (and going with more power is actually tricky on 110V outlets). But once boiled - it can hold a temperature.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 20, 2020
CommentsContent: The HadinEEon Variable Temperature Electric Kettle is really admirable for executing the perfect pour-over, also the product  comes with all sorts of features that aid in creating an ideal cup of coffee or tea. The controls allow to adjust the water temperature from 160 to 212 degrees Fahrenheit.Beeps when it‚Äôs ready, and will hold the temperature for a very long amount time which is really good which inturn saves lot of power ,as an added benefit the handle stays cool, and the spout doesn‚Äôt dribble when pouring.To have the perfect taste of tea or coffee, the kettle has temperature settings for required options of tea or coffee to select accordingly.The removable mesh filter is also an appreciable feature to clean any scale deposits.To conclude I really like this and it is worth purchasing .

CommentsTitle: Good, cheaper substitue to the Cuisinart variant
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 4, 2020
CommentsContent: After many years of use, my Cuisinart 1.7L variable temp electric kettle started leaking at the point where the handle joined to the water chamber. Until then I had been extremely satisfied with the product and initially thought to replace it with the same model. Then I saw this product for roughly half the price, and it seemed it could do pretty much everything the Cuisinart could. I decided to give it a shot and I am glad I did.The good: From my perspective, the product does technically do everything the Cuisinart did. I have been using for a few months now and I am satisfied, especially given the lower price tag.The bad: This is subjective, and these qualities may be more desirable compared to the Cuisinart, based on your own preferences. First, if you choose a temp that is less than boiling, I would guess this product takes slightly longer to heat the water than the Cuisinart. This is because once it gets close to temperature, the heating element begins to kick on and off to heat the water more gradually. The idea must be to avoid over-heating the water, but I have no way to test heating accuracy compared to the Cuisinart. I personally don't find this feature annoying, but my wife does - so you may want to keep it in mind. Second, the beeper that lets you know your water is up to temperature is much quieter than the Cuisinart. Again, this could be good or bad depending on your preferences. I tend to dislike this, as if I leave the kitchen I usually cannot hear the beeper go off.Overall, despite my minor gripes, I think the functionality your get for the cost is better than the Cuisinart, and would recommend.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 21, 2019
CommentsContent: I had gotten a regular HadinEEon electric Kettle for my son to use in his dorm. It was nice that he could make a cup of hot tea without going out in cold winter days in NY. I was excited to see this new version with variable temperature control with keep warm option. I‚Äôve been drinking tea for many years but did not know different types of tea have different idea temperature of making them!!! It took less than 4 minutes to heat up 6 cups of water for green tea. I also like the fact that this kettle was made with glass which does not alter the taste of water. Looking forward to my new tea drinking experience!!!

CommentsTitle: Drinking more tea than coffee now
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 12, 2019
CommentsContent: I had heard that different teas taste better when brewed at specific temperatures but never really gave it much mind until watching videos on youtube by  mei leaf. I decided to buy a kettle myself and test this out. Correct temperature really does make a difference. This kettle heats quickly as well allowing me to make a pot of tea in half the time than it took me using the microwave to boil water, and the flavor is so much better. The keep warm function is a lovely addition for my days off when I drink lots of tea while fasting.  The blue led light is also nice to look at and makes watching water boil fun.

CommentsTitle: A functional and dependable kettle, with a great aesthetic
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 20, 2020
CommentsContent: This kettle works really well overall. I've had it for 4 months now with no issues, it's lightweight and love the blue LED light. I wanted a kettle that had different temperature settings and this kettle is among the rare few that offers this feature. It works super well and is versatile to prepare different types of drinks: green tea vs. coffee vs. herbal teas. All of these require different temperatures so this kettle is great to accommodate a wide range of  beverages. Overall I'm satisfied with my purchase and recommend the kettle. The glass body is a must!

CommentsTitle: Meh! For the most part it does what it is supposed to...
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 31, 2020
CommentsContent: It is fine I guess, Things that annoy me, the start up, and stay warm, so you set the temp, hit start and warmup to keep it warm after it heats up, so it gets to the set temp, the blue light/heating element will click off, then back on, then off, then stay off but then 30 seconds later it will come back on, and why does this annoy me, because if I pick it up and fill my cup the kettle will turn off, you have to wait until is is fully heated and in keep warm mode, It will Beep, before you can pick it up, so if you are not careful, you come back to cold water and have to start the process again.Does it heat water, YesIs it a nice physical Design, YesCould the Interface/Functionality be a lot better, Absolutely

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 28, 2020
CommentsContent: This kettle is perfect for the wet bar in my bedroom. I heat up a full pot, set it to hold the temperature, and make cup after cup of tea while I read. I love the blue glow as the kettle heats. It's actually quite soothing in my room at night. The kettle heats to temperature quickly and holds temperature well. A couple times, I've drifted off to sleep without turning it off, and I've found it shut off in the morning, so the safety shut off feature definitely comes in handy. So far, I've only used it at the highest temperature, but I do appreciate the optional heat settings for milder teas, and I'm sure I'll use them in the future. I definitely recommend this kettle!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States June 5, 2020
CommentsContent: This kettle is the answer to make consistently good cups of tea.  I've spent enough time in SE Asia to cultivate a taste for a variety of teas.  Many of them such as green teas brew best at lower hot temperatures.  In the past, I've brought the water kettle to a full boil then make my best guess as to how long to set it aside before I poured it onto the tea.This is no longer necessary as I press the appropriate button according to the type of tea I'm brewing.  I especially like the temperature hold feature.  This is very helpful in the event I get sidetracked and not able to immediately brew the tea.  I highly recommend this clever product.

CommentsTitle: Electric Kettles Have Come a Long Way!
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 17, 2020
CommentsContent: I love this kettle! I used to have a traditional whistling tea kettle, but it was difficult to clean and the limescale ruined it. I threw it away after 13 years and looked into electric kettles instead. I haven‚Äôt had one since college and the technology has improved since then. This kettle is great! It heats up fast and I love that I can see through it. The lights make it fun to watch. It‚Äôs easy to clean and it has temperature settings for different kinds of tea and even coffee. I would not hesitate to buy this product again or give it as a gift to my tea-loving friends!

CommentsTitle: My New Favorite, Very Solid and Elegant Electric Kettle,
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 29, 2020
CommentsContent: I've been using electric kettles for over a decade as I drink copious amounts of tea requiring various temperatures. I usually stuck with the big name brands like Cuisinart, but they were very expensive and still ended up breaking after only a 2 years sometimes. I also usually went for Stainless Steel Kettles since I was always nervous around glass, but the review on this one were solid and it and the brand really looked like quality. So I decided to give it a try.Well, I am incredibly pleased! After several months, its become one of my favorite. It looks elegant, feels sturdy, and is also fairly quiet. The beeps are all a nice soft low volume (certain previous ones I had you could hear through the whole house and were incessant). The temperature are accurate and the controls/buttons also feel solid (some other models felt more flimsy or would struggle to make contact over time).I actually prefer the glass now because of how easy it is to see how much water is in there and whether I need to clean it. And on that note the top latch is nice and simple, no sharp metal edges or complex combination, just a solid top that connects sturdily with the glass, makes it easy to clean and fill. I was concerned about the blue lighting at night being too bright as my living room and tv is nearby, but it's not obnoxious at all and is gives the kitchen a modern feel on top of the pleasant design.Other models out there may be more powerful, but all that's going to do is shave 30 seconds off your cold-to-boil time and often times more powerful models would trip my breakers (I tend to have a lot of devices throughout the house, kitchen included, but never an obnoxious amount). This one has never caused such an issue so I actually prefer its power level as each apartment has its own electrical nuances that may make them sensitive or just be wired with undesirable layouts, but I don't have to worry about it with this one which is another unexpected plus.You will be pleased with this kettle :)

CommentsTitle: Variable temp selection for range of teas and coffee
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States June 9, 2019
CommentsContent: Marvelous water kettle with a great selection of various temperatures to which to heat for the various teas and types of coffee.  Instead of just heating to the default boil like most, this will let you select lower temps for delicate teas, green tea, etc.Added extra is that it is larger than most others as this is 2.0 liters so it's great for groups.  The 'keep warm' button is a great idea and very useful if you need hot water available over a long period of time.  Recommend this as the best available.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 20, 2020
CommentsContent: I initially bought this electric kettle due to the great customer reviews. The first one I bought worked great for the first two weeks. It heated up extremely quickly and it was able to retain that heat (continuously heated) for 12 hours straight. After two weeks, it started to make a buzzing sound. I contacted customer support and they sent a brand new one within 2 days.I understand how every product may not be perfect. That's why they have customer support‚Äîto deal with quality issues. Not everything can be tested. This company was able to stand by its product and provide top-notch customer support. I'll be happy to buy another product from them in the future. The new one I received has been working fine. However, I now have the peace of mind that if anything breaks, this company has a very robust warranty.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 26, 2020
CommentsContent: I ordered this teakettle and I enjoyed it but I was really missing a good way to brew loose leaf. I understand this one has a mesh strainer on the spout but pieces of loose tea would make it through every time without fail. I really enjoyed the LED blue light while it was brewing that changed when it reached temperature and how quick  easy it was to set temperature with all of the settings. Ultimately I found an AICOOK tea kettle that was meant to brew loose leaf. When I got it I did a test and started them both to brew 7 cups of water to 212. The AICOOK made it to temperature almost an entire minute before this kettle did. I also did not enjoy that the lid did not come completely off since I use filtered  water from my refrigerator door and it was difficult to fill with a lid that does not remove completely. When comparing the two, I also realized that the shape of the spout from where the water pours on this kettle sometimes made the water splash more so than the AICOOK one. I did enjoy how easy this one was to set the temperature quickly and easily and the auto warming function (AICOOK does also have the auto warming function but it will not work with the 212 degree setting because keeping temperature at 212 would result in constant boiling water that would evaporate quickly).Ultimately the AICOOK kettle was what I decided to keep but this was a nice kettle that had some good features as well. I have updated my review to a 5 star review despite returning this kettle because of the company's customer service. I feel confident that if you have any issue with this product, they will be willing to help solve it. I can not speak for AICOOKs customer service. I've attempted to reach out to them regarding the auto-warming function at temperature of 212 but I did not get any response. I found my answer by doing some research on my own. I do not feel confident that if I have any issues with my AICOOK kettle that company would be willing to fix them.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States April 2, 2021
CommentsContent: We really like this kettle. I think the water tastes better in glass. We use it mainly for tea and coffee. It heats up quickly and hold the selected temperature. It‚Äôs been 2,5 months of every day use, no issues. Used glass Hamilton beach kettle before for several years (Until something heavy landed on it from the top shelf)and that one had easier to press bottoms and smoother lid lock. But both kettles do equally good job heating the water and keeping it warm at the right temperature so I‚Äôm happy with the purchase and wish every Airbnb Place would have one in the kitchen.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 11, 2021
CommentsContent: This is the 4th different kettle we've bought on Amazon over the past 8 years and it seems to be the best one yet:- It has a clean look and can be kept clean by draining all excess water after each use- It comes with a small pouch of citric acid, which can be used once there is a calcium buildup at the bottom. Just add a teaspoon of citric acid with some water and bring to a boil. Drain and rinse. Looks like new.- The temperature settings seem accurate and the warming function works very wellI strongly suggest to use filtered water and only as much as you need each time. Then drain and set aside with the lid open.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States May 30, 2020
CommentsContent: I purchased this kettle because my single-cup coffee maker mutinied for the last time! I dusted off my French press and couldn't be happier.I chose this kettle for several reasons.#1. The 2,000+ very positive  Amazon  reviews. Even less positive reviews were satisfied with customer service.#2. The kettle has 6 heat settings taking the guesswork out of brewing the perfect cup of coffee or tea.#3. I wanted a glass kettle for easy cleaning. And I'm a pot watcher.#4. It comes with a 2 year warranty for full refund or replacement,  but the enclosed paperwork says you can register the product and become a VIP customer and the warranty extends to 3 years.After the kettle arrived (after just 2 days!)  I found more reasons to be pleased. The kettle takes up much less precious counterspace. It is visually very attractive, and the blue light is not only pleasing, but indicates that the heater is working. The button controls are clear and convenient and beep nicely when pressed. And most importantly, it does what it is supposed to do- heat water - well and quickly.The only negatives I can think of (and I'm really reaching here) are that the beeps are a little quiet, and and the kettle feels a little heavy, but that's probably the fault of the water, not the pot.I am very pleased with this product.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 4, 2019
CommentsContent: This is my first temp. controlled kettle. I had always wanted one, but they were always too expensive compared to the regular model. Enter the HadinEEonTemperature Electric Kettle. I absolutely love it. Has completely changed the way I make herb teas and french press coffee. If you ever wondered if the temperature of the water really makes a difference, I have two words for you: It does! If you are on the fence, give it a try. You will love it too. One design request: When I close the lid (at least on my kettle), it takes an extra effort to click it down one more time to make sure the lid is snuggly fitted down. If I fail to do this second click, the lid stays elevate a 1/4 inch or so, and the water pours out too wide. If you are too close to the cup, you risk spiling a bit on the counter from the wide pour, and at worst scalding yourself. It took me having a 'learning' experience' once or twice to now be firmly in the habit of double-checking, but I bet with a little engineering, they could solve this minor issue and make this wonderful kettle even more wonderful.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 13, 2020
CommentsContent: Not only is this electric kettle attractive out on my counter, but the temp control is awesome. We have an electric kettle at my office that I love using however if I get busy and cant monitor it, it shuts itself off after boiling so that when I have a moment to make my tea or coffee, I have to start it again. Sooo, when deciding I'd like one of these babies at home I looked for one that had a "keep warm" feature. Not only does this little guy have that, but also a few different temp settings of which the "Pressed Coffee" is my fav. Who knew? Being new to the pressed coffee game, I had no idea its not best to just pour boiling water into the press. There is also a Tea setting. Its also super fast and quiet until ready, then you get the beep. Buy one and love yourself for it!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States June 6, 2020
CommentsContent: I have been using this kettle for four months and am very satisfied with it. I love the fact that you can set specific temperatures for different types of beverages. I drink green tea and yerba mate daily, and these require different temperatures for best results. With this kettle, it is a breeze to brew my favorite beverages. It does take a longer time than I was used to for the water to boil (previously I used an electric kettle without temp control). The words on the temperature control buttons also are coming off from being pressed so often. But when everything is taken into account, I am still a happy camper. The material is sturdy. I love the glass body and being able to see the water come to a boil :-)

CommentsTitle: This is a really fun kettle to own!
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 24, 2020
CommentsContent:
Your browser does not support HTML5 video.










  
  
    
  ¬†I love this kettle! It holds a good amount of water, is sleek and attractive, and is just mesmerizing to watch!I love the fact it has so many great settings for my different teas, but my favorite feature is the "keep warm" function! My husband gets up a little earlier than I do in the morning, so he starts the kettle for me and uses the keep warm function so I'm guaranteed a perfect temperature water whenever I'm ready.8 cups boils in about 10 minutes which is way faster than my last kettle, but if you use less water, it comes to temperature faster.It is so easy to clean, and I've gotten many compliments on it. It also beeps when it's come to the selected temperature. Nothing loud or shrill, just two little beeps to alert you to its readiness.I would gladly buy this again!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 7, 2019
CommentsContent: Not worth it.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 26, 2021
CommentsContent: All electric kettles are not the same.  The HadinEEon variable temp 2.0L kettle is now the most used appliance in our kitchen.  From morning French Roast coffee and instant hash browns, to afternoon tea and sauce creations for dinner, we find we are using the kettle three or four times a day.  The selectable temperature is not a gimmick, it really does make better tasting tea and coffee when you have the option to reach lower temperature water than only boiling.  And the unit is blazingly fast, taking less than 1/2 the time to boil water than the stove top, and using less energy to boot. Love this kettle!

CommentsTitle: It does everything it says it does, and for a reasonable price
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 10, 2021
CommentsContent: After scalding one too many cups of my more delicate green teas, I wanted something that had actual temperature control, as opposed to me timing my kettle and removing it from the heating base and hoping that it was a better temperature.I am still surprised at how few kettles offer this feature, but this one does, and short of having tested it with a thermometer, seems to work well. The materials feel like a good quality, and the glass pitcher avoids the gross issue of limescale that I had previous kettle.All around, an upgrade from your typical, stainless steel kettle, and for the same price (if not better).

CommentsTitle: Keep warm function turns off when kettle is lifted from base
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 27, 2021
CommentsContent: I purchased this item because we are big fans of keeping a pot of water hot all day for tea. The 'keep warm' function shuts itself off when the kettle is removed from the base, though the directions say it is supposed to remain functional if the kettle is put back on the base within 20 seconds.Also going with a 1500w rather than 1200w, it makes a big difference in the time it takes to bring the water to boil.Try again.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 13, 2020
CommentsContent: You would think that everyone owns a kettle, but as a Brit living in the USA, I have found this is not true. Everyone should own a kettle, and it should be this one - a HadinEEon Variable Temperature Electric Kettle.Why?, Kettles only boil water, so what's the big deal?This Kettle has a couple of things going for it that your current saucepan (if you live in the USA) does not do. It is fast and super convenient, has 6 different temperature controls (and for a Tea drinking Brit, this is a big deal and it is extremely accurate too. If you happen to be in search for a Kettle replacement, then I can again only highly recommend this Kettle.What makes this Kettle stand out to me, are the following few points.1. The water capacity is 2.0liters, when most other Kettles only hold 1.5liters.2. It has temperature control (and for a Tea drinking Brit, this actually matters - A LOT)3. It is super fast in boiling 2.0 liters (I did not time it, but I did a compare against my older Kettle, and 2.0 liters boiled faster than the 1.5 liter Kettle (go figure)4. It is extremely good looking, and many of my US friends (who do not own a Kettle( have commented on how neat looking it is - as it is clear and illuminates with a blue light - really cool5. It is well built and feels like a solid piece of kit.So, this Kettle, even though it just boils water, is a very well put together Kettle, with some nice features, and is great looking too.

CommentsTitle: Where has this been all my life?
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 22, 2019
CommentsContent: We love this kettle! We have always used stovetop kettles and recently I got a gooseneck kettle but it leaks so bad and I don‚Äôt like to use it because it pours out slow as well. I am so impressed with the HadinEEOn variable temperature control kettle. Here are the few things I like about it:1) I like how I has different temperature settings for each type of tea or coffee you brew.2) I LOVE that it has a screen to filter out loose leaf teas or course ground coffee!!!! This is my favorite feature.3) It heats up in 5 min.4) It‚Äôs pretty to look at.5) I like that it holds 10 cups of water. We have a large family and make a lot of tea.I‚Äôm very pleased with this purchase.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States June 10, 2020
CommentsContent: I have had this electric  kettle for over two months now.  I bought it to replace another brand  kettle that I used for several years.  The quality on this one seems much better and it is very attractive.  I use it several times a day for making tea, coffee, and broth.  i like how it lights up at the bottom when it is being heated, which is not only practical but it makes it a fun experience to use. The diameter of the lid which is larger than the last one I had, makes it easier to use when I am refilling it. There is a keep warm function as well as buttons that are labeled with both the temperature and type of tea brewed at that temperature.  I researched various kettles and this one had all the features I wanted at a good price. I honestly can not think of any negatives to this product and I highly recommend it.

CommentsTitle: Great build quality, temperature controls, and looks nice too!
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 17, 2020
CommentsContent: We originally found this kettle while looking for a larger capacity kettle to go with our new 1.5L french press, and this one turned out to be the best electric kettle I have owned so far!Pros:- The capacity is as stated, up to 2.0L or as little as 0.5L if you just need a cup of tea.- The temperature controls are very accurate. There are settings for 160, 170, 180, 190, 200, and 212 degrees (F). It gets to 160-180 pretty fast, but 190 and 200 can take longer than just full boil, but that is because it flips the heat on and off a few times to make sure that it hits exactly the temperature specified instead of running +5-8 degrees like some other kettles I have owned.- It looks really nice.- I haven't had to clean it yet, but the filter is removable and there aren't any hidden areas for water to sit and form buildup (at least anywhere I have seen).- It has a really nice (and accurate) keep at temp setting!Cons:- One minor complaint - I would love it if the beep to let you know it's finished was a bit louder!  But don't let that stop you from getting this wonderful kettle!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States June 27, 2020
CommentsContent: So we've always loved having an electric kettle, and finally wanted to get one with all the bells and whistles.This one is perfect. We love using the temperature control, whether it's for coffee, tea, or just boiling water for ramen.I think the other best feature is that we can keep the temperature that we already set. This is so helpful because my guy, who is always up first, will make french press and then set to 212 F and usually about 15-20 min later I'll start making instant oatmeal and it's nice to have the water ready :)This product gets an A+

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 24, 2020
CommentsContent: We are very disappointed with this kettle.  More often than not we are not able to turn it on, the controls blink and no matter how many times we push then, nothing happens.  To make matters worse, this problem is getting worse and worse as time goes by.  We have been unable to use it at all for the past two days.  We would return it for a refund but unfortunately we have thrown out the box.  We strongly recommend that you do not buy this product, but if you do, keep the box for a future return.

CommentsTitle: Incredible features all wrapped up in one device!!
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States May 2, 2019
CommentsContent: I have wanted an electric kettle for a couple of years and I finally broke down and got one. I couldn't be happier!! So easy to use, great aesthetics as well as combining temperature control, wireless and a 12 hr warming feature. I love tea and have recently acquired a cold sensitivity that requires warm water to hydrate. This kettle has answered everyone of my needs!! Get one, you wont regret it!

CommentsTitle: A beautiful glass kettle and a company that has great customer service
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 9, 2020
CommentsContent: I purchased this kettle a few months ago mainly because it is stunningly beautiful and the blue lights and glass are eye catching.  I drink a lot of tea every day and this kettle has been my Go To kettle since my purchase.  Very fast heat up time, and the keep warm function enables you to still pour that cup of tea when you head back to the kitchen.  This kettle is beautiful, functional and any issues are quickly resolved by contacting customer service.  They have an extraordinary 3 year warranty, which is unheard of for an electric kettle.  Highly recommend.

CommentsTitle: Looks Great - Fast Boil - Extra Features
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States June 28, 2020
CommentsContent: This HadinEEon Electric Kettle replaced (another manufactures kettle) that lasted ~2 years. We use this kettle 2-3 times a day, it boils fast (1200W worth of power) The large capacity was another feature that we were looking for in a kettle and this had it. Never considered the feature "KEEP WARM" but this allows the kettle to hold the water at the required temperature, this is great if you are cooking and need hot water during the cooking steps, but don't want to wait/have time for the kettle to re-boil;, just press "KEEP WARM" and the kettle will do that for you. The last 3-4 kettles all have the blue LED feature (when on) this is a feature and looks 'cool' at night, day time it is on too, but in the evening/night this looks the best. As we seem to 'go-through' kettles, the 3-year warranty (hopefully never have to use it!) was another reason why we purchased this kettle. Being using it for >3 months and are still 100% happy with the purchase.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 10, 2020
CommentsContent: I had this kettle for only few days and here are my initial comments:Pro:1. Boils water fast2. Temperature control function is great3. LED light easily (and nicely) illuminated the  interior while using4. Sound indicating that the water reached desired temperature is not too loud and oppressive5. PrettyCons:1. I wish it was tiny bit sturdier. It doesn‚Äôt topple but needs slight adjustment while placing the kettle on the base2. The power cord is little stiff. That might change with time (like I said I only had this kettle for 3 days now)Overall:I would recommend it. It beats OXO Brew with adjustable temperature by far, which I purchased originally.

CommentsTitle: I do research when I buy something.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States June 8, 2020
CommentsContent: This is not an exception.  I researched for a few good hours.  I  would say 2 hours.  It is quite a long time imo.- The price is very competitive.  About just tat expensive than the average price.- I need to actually test this, but as long as the glass is strong enough, this is far the best design for the least risk for collision (no metal nuts or anything exposed) inside and mold problem (no gap between parts inside that can't be cleaned with hands).- All the possible temperature settings with warm function.- The base is covered silver metal on the side, so it blends in with whole design.  Most of the others just plain black.- Boiling fast enough.- 2L size is adequate for all-day tea drinking.- blue light comes on and it's not too bright or cheezy, so I like it.- coupons and gifts are always welcome.I don't have any cons, because I just received it.  I will come back and update my review when it doesn't hold my expectation.  So far, it's perfect.

CommentsTitle: Died in just 3 months - updated: Great Customer Service
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 21, 2021
CommentsContent: Update, increased from 1 to 4 stars: The company reached out personally after seeing the review and sent a replacement right away. That kind of customer service deserves a better rating. It‚Äôs a good kettle, and sometimes things don‚Äôt work right. What matters is that they made it right. I‚Äôll update again to five stars if this one lasts longer!We got this 3 months ago, and it worked as advertised for about 2.5 months. We‚Äôve taken good care of it, descaled it regularly. About a half a month ago it started randomly shutting off, and today, it died completely. Three months is a bad product life.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 2, 2020
CommentsContent: I looked around Amazon for electric kettles with temperature buttons, and when I saw the visual design of this one along with the affordable price, I knew I had to try it. The glowing reviews are warranted: I cannot really find a single fault with this product other than that the beeping sound it makes when the water is at the correct temperature is a little quiet. Quiet enough that you wouldn't be able to hear it in another room or if something else is making a constant noise in the kitchen. But if you just hit the keep warm button when you start it, this is less of a concern. Unless the kettle is completely full, boiling takes less than 5 minutes, and the less water you have the faster it will reach the desired temperature. This is honestly a great product that I wish I had had in my life earlier. I have finally started to drink several cups of black/green tea throughout the day and a couple of cups of herbal tea at night, and I drink this much every day. I just fill it up at night when it starts to get low and it's ready to make tea the next morning. I also use this for those ramen packages where you lift the lid halfway and pour boiling water in and close the lid for 3 minutes. Using boiled water from a microwave is very dangerous when making those sorts of ramens (like Cup Noodles), but this product makes it completely safe. I first learned about these when I was in Japan and it seemed like such a no-brainer product that I had to get one when I got back. I also use it to help boil additional water faster for when I'm boiling something in a pot on the stove. No complaints here!

CommentsTitle: Didn‚Äôt realize how much I would love this kettle
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States June 8, 2020
CommentsContent: I‚Äôve always loved tea but after working a contract position for a tea company last summer, it‚Äôs become my daily indulgence.  The company I worked for had two commercial water heaters which were fine (as long as they weren‚Äôt empty) but I really wanted my own for home, and possibly to use in my rental business for my customers.  I have to say that this might never go in the rental.  It‚Äôs just too wonderful.  I received it yesterday and have been able to try it today for the first time.  It heats up fast, gets to the exact perfect temperature and stays that way.  It‚Äôs so easy to use too!  And it‚Äôs also aesthetically pleasing‚ÄîI love the blue LED‚Äôs that let you know it‚Äôs working.  It has all the right temperatures to select from, many more than other models have.  If you‚Äôre a tea or a coffee drinker and use a French press, you will not be disappointed isn‚Äôt this purchase.

CommentsTitle: The Best thing if you need hot water fast and regularly. Great design and look!
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 28, 2020
CommentsContent: OK, so let me set the scenario/scene. We live in a moderate home with 2 full baths and off course a kitchen. The bathroom water supplies get hot in a matter of seconds, no complaints there. However, the kitchen is the farthest away from our water heater. That said, it takes about 5 minutes for the water to get hot and at 2 gpm that is a lot of wasted water. We welcomed our first grandchild, a Jersey girl who has a first time obsessive mom. She washes and sterilizes all of the baby bottles, utensils, etc on average twice daily and uses a lot of HOT water. I am listening to the water run and cringing. In enters my savior, the HadinEEon Electric Kettle. It heats the water fast. It attractively sits on the counter making everyone so happy. The large size provides ample hot water over and over and over again! We have put this kettle to the test and it is amazingly easy to use, friendly and dependable. We use the kettle for everything in the kitchen now, at least 10 times a day and it performs wonderfully. Needless to say we bought a back-up and I am getting ready to purchase a third. If you need HOT water on demand, you cant beat this kettle. Sorry about the long review, but we really love this kettle.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 23, 2019
CommentsContent: So far it's worked like a champ. We use ours daily and I wanted something that holds more water than the usual 4-6 cup kettles. It's about as loud while boiling as any kettle is, certainly quieter than our previous one. I love the metal strainer/filter over the spout (we have hard water and it keeps the flakes out of my tea). Easy to clean; just pour some vinegar and water in and boil. That descales everything without any scrubbing. I've never had a kettle with temperature buttons before but it's so convenient not to have to temp the water for different kinds of teas before brewing. I also LOVE the keep warm function. I turn it on while getting ready in the evenings and don't have to worry about reheating it if I forget or take too long. Definitely would recommend it! It's worth the price!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States June 4, 2020
CommentsContent: Update:Customer service is excellent!  This issue was taken care of without delay.  I would do business with this company again.Update:Customer service is spot on! They are working on a replacement to satisfy our hot water kettle needs.I purchased this kettle in February and I was very happy with it as it worked as described.Suddenly there is a gritty residue on the bottom metal and whitish flake type floating in my hot water.Only bottled water has been used in this kettle. I rinsed and let it dry at the end of the day.I used it again the following morning and it seemed fine until the next fill it happened again. I leave this unplugged, rinsed/cleaned and let air dry every night.  As you can see in one of the photos a line where I wiped the gritty.I'm worried as I had been drinking it until I noticed... it could be bad for our health, who knows what the heck it is. I'm hoping to hear from the seller ASAP.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 12, 2020
CommentsContent: So far, I have only used this kettle 5 times plus testing, which is not exactly a great example of its reliability, and I will revise this review after I have used this kettle for longer periods of time,  like 1-month, 3-months, and 6-months. Three major sections jump out at me: The parts I really love, the parts I think they could improve, and the parts that are neutral.The Pros:+ The glass and light combination makes the kettle look mesmerizing when in use, doubled by the trend for the water to develop currents that draw and hold the eye.+ The capacity is quite large, and is very useful for making Southern Sweet Tea by the gallon, or making stock from bouillon to put into soups or stews.+ The temperature buttons, which are quite accurate as I tested with an external thermometer, make brewing different types of tea a breeze (I'm especially a fan of green teas and french press coffee, so this is wonderful!)The Cons- The handle is quite large and not very ergonomic. I have larger hands as tall male college student, and I find the handle section to be very thick and hard to grasp firmly- Its very heavy, even without water in it. This isn't a deal-breaker for me, as I don't struggle with lifting or moving heavy objects, but my mother or grandmother would probably struggle quite a bit with it. With  decent quantity of water, the problem is exacerbated.Overall, this kettle stacks up well against the market. That says, I am curious as to how it will last over time, and I was glad to see that HadinEEon includes a 3-year manufacturers' warranty.Disclaimer: the main reason I am writing this review now instead of using the product for a month first, as is my norm, is due to the reward for an honest review that included randomly with some orders. I will update this review as needed as I test the long-term reliability and features of this product, as well as customer service if I need to use my warranty.

CommentsTitle: Heats water quickly and easy to clean
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 3, 2021
CommentsContent: I bought this to replace a plastic electric kettle which didn't have variable temperature control. It takes about 10 minutes to heat a full kettle of water, but for a cup or two it is much quicker. There is a soft beep once it's done boiling, which I like because I tend to set the kettle and walk off to do something, so it reminds me that I was in the middle of making tea. The lid has a latch, which opens easily, and it opens wide for easy cleaning. And the blue light is a nice feature. Overall, very satisfied with this kettle.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 24, 2020
CommentsContent: I drink a lot of tea so I thought it was time to upgrade to a tea kettle that could do more than just boil water. My kettle came quickly & was packaged safely. I love the blue LED (it's a nice touch) and I appreciate that the beeps to tell you it is done aren't too loud but I do sometimes miss them. It boils water quickly (and I really appreciate the stay warm feature). It takes a bit more time to do the other temperatures just because it has to turn on/off a few times in order to reach the proper temperature but I would imagine that would be the same among all appliances like this & it's worth the wait in my opinion.All-in-all I am very pleased with my purchase & I have used it every day (sometimes multiple times a day) since I purchased at the end of July and still looks and feels brand new. I'm happy I bought this Electric Kettle & would recommend it to anyone who needs a new one!

CommentsTitle: Did not expect such quality from a mere kettle, but this is no ordinary kettle!
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 1, 2019
CommentsContent: I went through a couple kettles in the past for my coffee, tea, and all sorts that required water to be quickly boiled/hot. My last one just broke, so I decided to shop around for some kettles, this was when I came across this monster.The price was a little scary and wasn't sure if I wanted to spend that much on a kettle, but after reading about the product and its features I decided to go ahead and purchase it.Receiving the product: I was a little overwhelmed by the features and buttons it had since I have never used precise water boiling to specific temperatures before. But since I am a bit of a tech nerd I decided to try them out, immediately. I loved the way it decided the water temperature and keep it at a constant temperature that you selected, starting up to a boil, stops, heats a little bit more, then finally beeps to let you know it is ready. A little different from a normal kettle that will go full blast to the peak of boiling and then just shut off.This was the most shocking part of the kettle. My coffee and tea tasted different and came out differently. I know this is a weird thing to say, but having the temperature specifically set to what you want actually makes a difference in the taste. It does burn the coffee nor tea leaves so the water temp perfectly meshes with the product you are making. I was so shocked, and so hyped, I made about 20 cups that day. Keeping the water warm is a great feature as well for a heavy drinker like me.Honestly, if I knew this existed and knew what I was getting out of it, I would have gotten it earlier. It was a pleasantly shocking and now I can say that for the price, it is definitely worth it.  You got a fan!

CommentsTitle: Defective Key Feature:  No Beeping When Water is Ready
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 15, 2020
CommentsContent: First time I've gotten stuck with a defective product:  I plug it in, go about my business, and wait and wait -- NO BEEPING!  so each time (at least 2x a day), I have to try to figure out how long the blue lights at the bottom have been off and whether I need to start all over.  I contacted Amazon Prime's "product support chat" who could not tell me how to turn on the beep -- no fix offered, just a platry $12 for the beep not working.  It would cost me that much in packaging, gas and time. hassle etc. to return it.  Products should be quality-checked for this type of discoverable defect before offering up for sale, and seller AND Amazon Prime should have been highly concerned that a customer rec'd a defective product.  The beeping is THE central feature since we'd like to know when the water is ready unless you want to just STAND there the whole time -- then you may as well just put water in a pot and wait and watch it boil.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 17, 2020
CommentsContent: Just received this today and boiled 2 kettles almost full.  Very fast for a 1,200W kettle.  The quality seems very good and the larger size is nice.  The buttons are easy to press and I like the way the lid latches.  I had purchased another big name brand (Cuisinart) and the lid wouldn't stay shut when pouring or anything else for that matter.  It even opened once while heating water.  I returned it to the store where I purchased it and ordered this one from Amazon based on the great reviews.  So far, I am very pleased with my purchase.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 20, 2020
CommentsContent: Really liked product for about 4 days- then started having probems. I am waiting for a replacement product. Customer services has not be "stellar" Called Amazon, they say to go through Hadineeon. Contact Hadineeon, via email, messanger & phone. Person on took all information. Has taken a week to connect with someone and I am still waiting for some confirmation that I will receive a replacement. I will update this review if and when I receive my replacement.  NOTE: Product states "fullfilled by Amazon" but I have to go through Hadineeon for issues???Update 02-02-2021:  So getting though to someone in the beginning was really a hassle. Once I found the correct  communication method and got it replaced, It works just as I expected and I love it.  In fact, I bought another one for my mother for Christmas and she loves hers too.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 18, 2019
CommentsContent: I have been searching for a teapot for a while, until I got this one. What I want is a temperature control function for heating up the water and a keep warm function that keeps the water at the set temperature for a few hours. Also, I prefer the pot made entirely of either glass or stainless steel, without the water touching any plastic parts. However, most stainless steel pot have a plastic window for viewing the water level.This teapot has all the features I want, is of obviously high quantity materials, Ang heats up fast to exact temperature. Five stars.

CommentsTitle: Purifies H2O Audible & Visual Light Indicators Outstanding Quality Fair Price Guarantee & Warranty
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 18, 2020
CommentsContent: Believe it or not, decreasing the amount of sugar my family consumes guided this purchase of a HadinEEon Temperature Variable Electric Kettle. When we eliminated sugar and artificial sweeteners from our tea, we noticed a bitter taste. Once I realized our electric, ‚Äúboils water only‚Äù kettle was producing a less than desirable cup of tea, I began a quest to find an affordable, temperature-controlled kettle. After several hours online searching electric kettles, reviewing specifications and customer reviews, I found the HadinEEon Temperature Variable Electric Kettle, model #GK2003CT. Upon reading Amazon‚Äôs numerous enthusiastic evaluations on HadinEEon kettles I decided to visit HadinEEon‚Äôs website to check out the company and their products before making a final decision. The first thing that impressed me is the way HadinEEon stands behind their products with an outstanding three-year (2+1-year free extension) warranty and 180 days free return shipping as evidenced by their one-year money back guarantee. Most of the other kettle brands reviewed up to this point offered a one-year warranty with no mention of money back guarantee or free return shipping. The next remarkable point is the HadinEEon commitment to priority customer support. The HadinEEon website shares consumer questions for each product with detailed answers, tips and support offered for each customer inquiry. I learned a great deal about the HadinEEon Temperature Variable Electric Kettle by reading the question and answer section. For me, the most relevant fact I learned is not to make tea in the kettle; pour the heated water into another container to make the tea. Making tea in the kettle could cause damage over time. On this journey I seriously considered other brand name temperature-controlled kettles which included a removable tea infuser to brew loose leaf or bag tea in one simple step. Perhaps that is why some of the other brands only offer a one-year warranty. The HadinEEon kettle and base boasts a beautiful streamline appearance with lovely borosilicate glass and stainless-steel design. The kettle has large 2.0L capacity with liquid measurements clearly marked. It possesses many safety features such as a Start/Stop button, cover has a lid release button, comfortable ergonomic heat resistance handle, boil dry protection and automatic shut-off. Kettle parts are FDA approved and the plastic is BPA free. No plastic on the inside; heated water will not encounter the plastic parts. No California P65 health warnings. Kettle is well balanced in hand with a wonderful pour. The multi-directional cord-free power base not only eliminates having a cord constantly in the wrong place dangling over counter edge or getting wet at the sink; it‚Äôs a fantastic solution for both lefties and righties. Favorite features ‚Äì the kettle purifies the water and has a removable scale mesh filter for cleaning. I can easily reach in the kettle through the wide-open lid mouth to clean without my arm getting trapped inside. I absolutely adore the control panel‚Äôs six variable temperature controls which show both the Fahrenheit temperature and type of beverage best suited to promote optimal brewing, the four-hour keep warm button and memory functions. Kettle communicates each stage of operation with audible beeps and visual blue light indicators that flash and illuminate the buttons and kettle base. Oh, did I mention the dancing bubbles or blue is my favorite color? Outstanding quality at a very fair price. The instruction manual is clear and concise with attention to detail focused on safety, kettle diagram, product features, operation, care & cleaning, 3-year warranty, descaling, storage, and customer support. Manual includes extensive temperature control table listing an astounding 66 beverages. Makes a perfectly delicious cup of tea! We are trying all the different types of tea in family member-only tea tastings. Great new household hobby during COVID19 pandemic as we isolate at home. Fortunately, Amazon has a vast variety of tea we can order online for next-day hands free delivery. Amazon will be busy this holiday season delivering our HadinEEon Christmas gifts!!!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 18, 2020
CommentsContent: I previously had the 1.7L Chefman Electric Kettle with Tea Infuser & Keep Warm Function & loved it, but just short of 3 years, it finally died on me. I tried to be frugal during these trying times & would boil water & prep my teas & coffee ahead of time, but it was just too much to do with everything going on in my life. I needed another electric kettle.Enter this 2.0L HadinEEon Electric Kettle with strainer & Keep Warm Function. The first kettle I ordered never arrived, though Amazon did refund me which allowed me to place another order which arrived promptly the next day (with no extra shipping cost). Here's where this kettle excels over the chefman: intuitive temperature control buttons - they're on the handle with the label of what temperature to use when! No having to press buttons that reset each time to scroll through temperature presets. The Keep Warm function is also intuitive - press the temperature, press Keep Warm, then press start. My previous kettle kept resetting (though it would automatically keep my water warm whenever it boiled).Complaints: This is more a circumstance of my fridge, but the kettle is too big to fit underneath the faucet of my fridge, so I need a large measuring cup to fill my kettle. Another thing is the release button is on top of the kettle vs a button on the handle which I'm not a fan of, but overall, the kettle itself works fantastic & will boil 2 cups of water at 212 degrees Fahrenheit within a few minutes (the length it took me to type this paragraph).

CommentsTitle: Love the different temperature settings for different teas
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 27, 2020
CommentsContent: I ordered this pot to replace a different one I had. I love that it has different temperature settings for different types of teas. I noticed the top lid can get pretty hot. and you really have to push it down to latch it shut otherwise it spills when pouring. Relatives in the house didn't do this and thus there was a pretty big spill when I casually grabbed it to pour. The light is cool but not necessary. I like that it can hold the temp. Its fast, can get really hot - boiling. I've used it everyday for months and its still working well. I think overtime the writing on the rubber buttons might wear off - tho it hasn't yet so we'll see. But its a good pot overall. Happy with it. It's great for tea drinkers like myself.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 17, 2019
CommentsContent: For the longest time, I have been using a pot with boiled water to make my coffee.  After looking at various different products, I decided to stick with this kettle based on the feedback from other consumers.  Also, the pictures showing the cool blue LED light while the water is boiling intrigued me.  So far, I am very happy with my purchase!  The kettle is really easy to use, really cool-looking, and prepares hot water in just a few minutes.  I think the only thing so far that I am just going to nitpick is the somewhat difficulty in drying the water on the inside.  Based on other reviews, I want to ensure that the kettle does not get rust due to negligence.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 21, 2020
CommentsContent: Followed the cleaning directions of boiling a full pot (8 cups) at highest temperature (212 degrees) & pouring out.  Took over 10 minutes to heat.  Pot still strongly smells like glue & chemicals.  Did it a few times, and the strong smell remains.  The owner's manual says not to use chemicals, which I'm assuming is dish detergent, but I'm sure tempted to use it.  Haven't tested the temperature at each setting, so not sure how to rate it.  The item arrived yesterday, & I'm not sure if I'm keeping it yet.  UPDATE:  Returned it after 1 day of trying to remove the odors.  Seller seemed eager to send a mailing label and was prompt with the refund.  There are so many reviews on this item because the seller offers gifts for writing a review.

CommentsTitle: I LOVE it! No regrets! This is the one. :)
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 19, 2021
CommentsContent: Okay, let me start off by saying that for a long long longggg time I sat through amazon and many other websites trying to find the right kettle because I wanted to make sure I got something that was1. affordable2.durable3.sleekI LOVE this tea kettle. It fits all my qualifications. I have absolutely no regrets in my purchase. The variable temperature buttons, w/ the stay warm feature, topped with the blue light it has when it's boiling the water as an indicator. But the beeping sound for when the water is done is very soft so if you want something loud it may not be for you. Loud beep or not, didn't matter to me because I leave it on the stay warm feature as I run around the house to complete other tasks. It's exceeded my expectations. I use it mainly for boiling water for my tea because I'm a tea fanatic lol. Also, if you like Ramen noodles -- definitely a quick way to warm up your water. It's just really been a game changer. I am highly pleased and would recommend this 100%.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 23, 2020
CommentsContent: Updates!!!!!!!!2nd replacement kettle just stopped working within a month also. Not going to waste time and energy here going back and forth for crappy products with the manufacturer. Just ordered a reliable brand "Krups" for the same price that has an outstanding history and reliability. Save your time, money, and don't fall for these fabricated paid reviews!!!!Old Review!!!One of the best electric kettles out there!!! Really really happy with the features and performance so far. Ran into an issue within 2 weeks and the manufacturer was swift to resolve and send a brand new one!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 29, 2020
CommentsContent: This is super easy to use! It lights up when it is on and lights go off when it is done, even if you can't hear the beeping over other noises in the room. Temperature seems to be pretty accurate and pot hold in heat well so you don't loose too much heat if you forget to use the Keep Warm function. This is perfect for those long teas sessions where you really need to control your temp or you have burned or weak tea. I've been using this multiple times per day since it arrived and I love it so far!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 21, 2021
CommentsContent: The HadinEEon Electric Kettle is impressive.  I use it almost daily to boil water for tea, however, the kettle size holds enough water (approximately 8 cups) for multiple cups at a time.  It also is very handy when I need a quick cup of boiling water for ramen and other dry noodle soups.The kettle is made well and is somewhat of a ‚Äòshow‚Äô piece. I especially like the large see-thru glass; it seems unusually bright and clear.  I have had my kettle for almost a year and it does not show any wear; it looks as good as it did out of the box.  It is especially appealing to look at, unlike my previous electric kettle that showed the heating coils.  The retractable chord is a smart feature.  I like how it retracts into the base, leaving no chords stretched around the counter.  These features just add to the overall sleek look of this modern kettle.The kettle is very easy to use. The blue LED light at the base illuminates when it is heating and there is a small beep when it is ready to use.  The handle grip is very sturdy with a secure grip - making it very easy to pour without any drips or spilling.  The lid opens up wide, allowing me to clean out the kettle and rinse off after cleaning the buildup from hard water.Amazon delivered the package on time.  It was securely packed and easy to use out of the box.  Although I have not needed to contact customer service, based on the reviews I have read - the company seems to provide excellent customer service as well as a warranty for the kettle.I highly recommend you try this product.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States June 5, 2020
CommentsContent: Boil-dry protection, once kicks in, needs long time to cool off to reset. The lid mechanism is too complex for its own good. It broke after a few months of use, now the lid does not stay closed. A simple removable lid would have been fine. Possibly because the lid does not stay closed water boils for too long before temperature sensor turns it off.

CommentsTitle: A wonderful kitchen product! I really needed it!
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 17, 2021
CommentsContent: I was so used to the office where we had a hotpot with water always ready for making tea. Now that I've been working form home, my previous electric kettle was such a pain to restart each time I needed hot water for another cup of tea. The HadinEEon Kettle works amazing at maintaining a constant 212 degrees (or other temps) for tea whenever I'm ready.  I tend to drink anywhere between 4 - 10 cups a day, so this kettle has been a godsend. My parents have a Cuisinart kettle, but there's broke and had to be sent back already... my HadinEEon is still tromping on after several months of constant use. I'm in love with this kettle... it is so fast compared to my old one, and it holds so much water! I made a great choice in this one.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 25, 2019
CommentsContent: The glass cracked by the second use. Used it completely normally, just refilling it after a less-than-boiling use and the glass cracked. Had to return it. Seemed like a useful heater if it wasn't so delicate.

CommentsTitle: Not worth the time or money
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 18, 2021
CommentsContent: Advertised as heating water faster and quieter than most electric kettles on the market. I could have taken the very NOT quiet heating had the water come to 200F within a reasonable time. After the first day of waiting seemingly forever for the water to heat, I timed it the second day. 14 minute, 26 seconds. To get to 200F. Ridiculous.Also, the advertising/product description on Amazon is conflicting, confusing and misleading. The name of the product says, "8 Big Cups 2.0L," whilst the info "from the manufacturer" lower on the page says, "10 Cups, 1.8L." Apparently math isn't HadinEEon's strength, nor is consistency. The kettle is 8 Cups, which is 1.89L, not 2L, not 10 cups.The base of the unit is oddly light, so it only sits flat when the kettle is on it, otherwise it is propped up by the cord. Speaking of the cord, ours was lazily bent during packing so it's indented to the point I had to look really close to see that it wasn't cut. (I don't trust that it won't tear along the indentation over time, posing a fire risk.)The pluses: The aesthetics are pleasing. The handle is cool to the touch. The lid opens easily for cleaning/drying. Despite the product dimensions stating this kettle is 10.5" tall (perhaps that's referring to the box?), it is actually 9.5" tall, which means I was able to fit it in my refrigerator door (filtered) tap.Due to the ridiculously long time to heat water, I've reported our kettle as defective. I'm hoping when the replacement kettle arrives to find that this one was, indeed, defective and to update my review accordingly.ETA: The replacement kettle heats in 13mins 24secs, a mere one minute faster than the first one we received and still more than twice what is advertised. I still do not recommend this kettle.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States June 17, 2020
CommentsContent: I use this kettle multiple times a day!  It is outstanding for temperature control, sometimes I want a rolling boil and other times simple warm, it works brilliantly at both temperatures and gives me a clear choice.  Love the see through quality so I can prevent hard water scale common in our area.  I would buy this kettle for all my coffee and tea loving friends.  The large size is wonderful for a full pot pot coffee. Sturdy, temperature controlled, large size and see through, all outstanding qualities for an electric kettle!

CommentsTitle: Very good quality and fast electric kettle
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 30, 2021
CommentsContent: I am very happy with this kettle. Very simple to use and very good quality materials. It works really fast! previously I used the gas range to heat water and bring to boil but that process is a mess , slow and you cant' control the temperature. this kettle have several pre-set temperature set point that makes very easy to control the temperature. besides of that the crystal bowl is very useful since you can se the water level and condition. The kettle is very powerful and works nice for me.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 24, 2021
CommentsContent: We had used a Cuisinart tea kettle for years. It had similar features and was solid stainless steel. I thought I would try this one and and was glad I did. Being able to watch the water boil is cool and the blue light which goes off when you hit your temperature is a nice visual aid. It also has more capacity as far as how much water it will hold. It gets to temperature fast even when at full capacity. Only thing I wish was different was the volume of the "beeper". It is barely audible.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States June 15, 2020
CommentsContent: I recently moved and was in need of a new electric kettle since I had been using my roommates. I looked at tons of kettles and I had come to realize I wanted some specific features:-Temperature control-Glass body so I can see the inside of the kettle to make sure I keep it clean-LEDs since I like LEDs and the aesthetic ( Õ°¬∞ Õú ñ Õ°¬∞)-A lid that opens at least 90¬∞-Around 50 dollars and has mostly positive reviewsThis one seemed to fit the bill and I was tired of comparing kettles so I took the plunge. It arrived today and I used it to make some instant mix coffee and some various teas. Overall, I think this is a good kettle. I am mostly impressed and satisfied with my purchase:-Temperature control works well and has a good range-LED backlit buttons are made of rubber which have a nice texture / pushing feeling to them-I like the filter to the spout, when pouring I can definitely tell its filtering and not there for aesthetics-The cord is adjustable and wraps around the bottom of the base, so cable management is pretty easy-The kettle is pretty big (see pictures with my hand for reference)-The LEDs look great (see pictures) - pleasant to look at when powered on-The glass body looks great (see pictures) - I am no glass expert, but the appearance and touch definitely has me content with the quality of the glass, doesn't seem like it'll crack due to heating/cooling or anything-Has a 3 year warranty-Heats up the water faster than expected-Auto-shut off works well-Has a keep warm feature that I may or may not ever use, but it works when I used it-Lid opens 90¬∞ and the opening is very large, so I can both fill it easily and stick my hand in there to do cleaning (yay!)I do have some minor gripes about the design, but they aren't that big of a deal:-While the lid both opens wide and is a large diameter, it is also awkward to open. You have to pull back on a contraption / tab and lift the lid open by rotating it - unless I am mistaken, the lid is not springloaded. At about 45¬∞ it feels like there is some internal resistance to opening it further so you have to put in additional force to opening it. Not the biggest deal in the world, but it's annoying enough for me to notice since I am used to a springloaded lid that had a very simple and consistent functionality. I should also note that closing the lid doesn't have a very tactile experience either, you have to press down rather hard to get it to close all the way. I think this area could use some minor redesign.-The base is very light weight, so when you initially plug it in without the kettle attached, the rigidness of the cable is enough to keep it from laying flat. When you put the kettle down, it's no longer an issue, but perhaps adding some weight to it wouldn't hurt either.-The handle is made of plastic and doesn't have a lot of "mass" to it, so it doesn't feel very robust. The first thing I thought when I picked it up was, "I wish this felt more rigid", but it shouldn't be an issue. Just had a weird weight distribution when first picking it up to pour.Edit: Just wanted to note the 5 stars also applies to the seller's customer support and communication, very prompt response for warranty and feedback!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 24, 2019
CommentsContent: This was a fairly ok kettle, the best part is it doesn‚Äôt have much plastic in the kettle compared to other models.  However it completely malfunctioned after two months of light use which was a surprise given the high star ratings.  There is a 12 month warranty so the manufacturers replaced it right away, but it would give me pause to buy anything else from them because I can‚Äôt imagine this will last past the 12 months.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 5, 2020
CommentsContent: We ordered this several weeks ago to replace an old plastic version we had previously used. I love the multiple choices of temperatures available for different types of tea and that it lists what type of tea for which each temperature should be used. Apparently I am not enough of a connoisseur of teas to realize prior to buying this that different types of tea require different brewing temperatures.  I also like that there are no exposed coils and that this kettle is glass.
